Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Kamila0105
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Room: clean, cheaper rooms are dark. Hotel: perfect location for Las Ramblas and port and also for Sagrada Familia. Internet: free wi-fi in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: John-Howth
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb. Very easy to get to from the airport. The hotel is very clean and nicely decorated. The rooms are a good size. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was excellent. I would recommend this hotel very highly and will definitely stay here again when I am next in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Dark room but great location for all sights”
Reviews.Author: eileen p
Reviews.Content: We were slightly disappointed to be given a room with no view only one side window so close to the next building that you had to lean out and look up to see what the weather was like! But it was a very good size suite lovely large bed with double sinks in the bathroom and we decided it would at least be quiet. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful pointing out the sights and helping with the room safe. As others have said the big plus is the location. Handy for all the main tourist areas. A very nice coffee shop across the road to the right Matamala did great coffee and pastries for breakfast and a good line in Tapas at lunch time. Obama's bar next to the hotel also good ,nice selection of beers and cocktails and food tho we didn't eat there. We also had a lovely meal in a small restaurant somewhere behind the Gothic cathedral called Sukor. We liked the atmosphere of the hotel very individual decor especially the staircase. Didn't have a "chain" feel. Would recommend as a good place to explore a very distinctive city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience for the money paid”
Reviews.Author: K_gphysiocenter
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas in Barcelona. We stayed in Avenida which was a terrible experience. We changed room 3 times because the central heating didn't function and finally they brought us a mobile air heater for the bathroom. Breakfast was poor and overvalued, there wasn't concierge,there wasn't piano bar like they published through the net, the personnel is from average to bad and every time the metro passes you think you will experience an earthquake. I do not recommend you this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lindaholidaylover Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent for our first trip to Barcelona. We didn't eat at the hotel, was expensive and with so many other places to eat in the city there was no benefit. Breakfast for 20 euros was way over the top! Location, location,location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda T
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Avenida Palace for my husbands 50th birthday. I read some of the reviews after booking and was concerned by some of the comments however on arrival we were very happy with our choice of hotel. The location is perfect. We were allocated room 811 - thank you Javier. What a fantastic room, a small juliet balcony to the front and a huge terrace to the side giving us views across Barcelona. Breakfast was included which offered plenty choice although the top ups of coffee were hard to come by, the waiters were more interested in clearing and cleaning empty tables. The hotel could do with a lick of paint, bathroom tiles re gouting and some of the carpets replacing but we had a great stay.................until some scum bag stole our rucksack containing a camera, expensive sunglasses x 2 pairs and other belongings from Starbucks whilst we had a coffee. Thanks whoever you are, pictures of my husbands 50th birthday holiday gone forever.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Avenida Palace Barcelona - very nice!”
Reviews.Author: prill123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Avenida Palace while on a tour from the U.S. There were about 50 us. We arrived about 7:30 a.m. and of course rooms weren't ready at that time of day. I was traveling with my daughter who was pregnant at the time. When we told the desk clerk that we would like a room right away, they got us in within an hour. We had a very nice room with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The whole front desk staff were very nice and accommodating. They recommended great restaurants each night and were very helpful. The lobby and front of the hotel are beautiful. We had breakfast included each day in our tour. Lots of food and a good variety. The location of this hotel could not be better. Right in the middle of everything and easy to walk to lots of places. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “great city”
Reviews.Author: mark w Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was situated right in the centre - brilliant with a great coffee shop on corner. Hotel staff very obliging and even found us a dentist as an emergency. Can't fault the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Avenida Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. It was better than I had imagined before arrival. The hotel is actually an old castle that was converted to a hotel. It has housed visitors such as Ernest Hemmingway, Liza Minnelli, The Beatles, and others. It made me feel that I was back in a historic time period. The decor was what amazed me the most. There's nothing but good to say about this establishment. It's the perfect place to stay for sightseeing and to enjoy the 24/7 action. Besides, Barcelona, Spain is known as "the city that never sleeps". Sorry New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: moohouse
Reviews.Content: I don't think you could find a better located hotel for Barcelona sight seeing! We had a wonderful corner room on the 9th floor (the staff had very kindly and generously followed up my request for us to have a room on as high a floor as possible) which was very generous in size and really clean. Breakfasts were lovely and the staff were friendly but not overly intrusive. Location is absolutely perfect - got the bus from the airport then a short walk from Placa Catalunya and we were there. La Ramblas, Casa Mila and many of the other famous Barcelona spots are literally a 5 min walk away and we could see Sagrada Familia from our room. Couldn't fault the hotel at all :-)

Reviews.Title: “flabbergasted Terrible”
Reviews.Author: yuka m
Reviews.Content: hotel stuff was terrible.not kind people I was flabbergasted, is this 4stars hotel????? we stay 3 days in juniorsuit they did not clean much just change towel and bedmaking. again,sutff is very like,,,,What's your problem? so disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane P
Reviews.Content: Stayed Avenida Palace in March 2012 with 7 friends. First trip to Barcelona and we could not have stayed in a better hotel. The staff were amazing, friendly, accommodating, full of helpful tips and hints on how to make the most of our stay. Food was very good, rooms were good, the only thing that would have made it perfect was tea and coffee making facilities. Fantastic location very close to all the shops. Great bar next door Obamas worth a visit great atmosphere. Special mention to Javiar, deputy manager, who could not have been more helpful, why dont all hotels have staff as good as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Avendia Palace, A Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: John1418
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 4 days in the Hotel avendia Place Grand Via Barcelona in Febuary 2012. This Hotel is one of the best hotels we have stayed in Barcelona, normally we would go to a hotel off Los Ramblas , But decided to try the Avendia, are we delighted we did, This Hotel has it all, You go back in time when you Check in, Checked in about 5 minutes flat, Porter got the bags showed us into our room, explained all about the tv the safe and other things we should know about the room , then out the door like a shot ,NOT waiting for his tip like a lot of porters do, AN Eye Opener, The room was on the 4th Floor overlooking the main Street ,We thought we were in New York ,The Bed was Big and very Comfortable, Rang down for more Pillows, Service was very Quick, two drawbacks about this hotel. ( 1 ) No tea or Coffee Maker in the room ,not unuasual in spain, we do like a coffee first thing in the morning, ( 2 ) The price of a drink in the bar was way out of my League .€10 for a Whiskey, but there is a nice Bar 2 doors down the street and Drinks were Half the price, Puting aside the two Drawbacks this hotel was one of the best Hotels we stayed in,

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: amarokChepstowWales
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a package with flights (BA Club Europe) through the AAgetaways website, the hotel therefore chose me, as opposed to the other way around, however this was not an issue as the Avenida immediately gives the impression of a good hotel. The arrangments were all in order and we arrived at 1830 on the 11th we were shown to our room (6th floor) which was very comfortable,twin beds good bathroom size and a safe worked by the 4 digit code, typical across hotels nowadays, the only downside is the vibration that the hotel suffers when a Metro train passes along the line which must be directly under the building, they do stop about midnight but on a Saturday night provide an all night service. The buffet breakfast was typical of any European hotel that I have stayed in, a good selection of pastries, cereals, and juices, followed by bacon, sausage and scrambled eggs, one guest asked for a fried egg, and this was done in minutes. Tea and coffee are brought to the table as required, though the tea is particuarly weak (for my tastes) All of the staff that we met were pleasant and polite and were happy to answer any queries. When you first leave the hotel doors and venture outside, the location becomes a sure fire winner, to the right is La Rambla, and to the left is Passeig De Gracia, a lot of the sights are off either of these two roads. The Metro provides a good service on various lines around the city, and the price is good, 2 Euros for a single trip, if you buy 10 single trip tickets this comes down to under 1 Euro, various Rovers are available as well. Taxi's are also relatively cheap, and if there are more than 3 of you then a taxi would probably be cheaper than the Metro. The works of Gaudi are a big influence on Barcelona, from the Sagrada Familia to La Pedrera and many other buildings besides. The Sagrada Familia is probably the best known of them all and well worth a visit, it will "blow you away" my wife and I intend to return when the building work is completed (2026) 100 years after Gaudi's death. We ate an evening meal at the Avenida, and found it to be both reasonably priced and good quality, the hotel seemed very quiet during our stay, which did surpirise me a bit. Travel to and from the airport is easy and a shuttle bus run every 6 minutes from 0500-0100 from either T1 or T2 and finishes/starts at Placa de Catalunya, just one block from the Avenida, my wife and I travelled on the train from the airport to the centre and were subjected to a failed pick-pocket attempt when we left the station for street level (not nice!), needless to say our journey back to the airport was on the shuttle bus ! All the guide books warn about pick-pockets and they seem to be correct, however this did not spoil our stay in Barcelona and has not put us off returning in 2027 when we will celebrate our 50th anniversary !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: coloradorailfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Avenida six days in February 2012. The location is superb. Subway stop just around the corner and a couple of blocks walk to the major station at Catalunya and Rambla. First room was adequate but noisy at it was adjacent to the service elevator (avoid room 850) but after a change a somewhat bigger and better room was better. Room rate seemed reasonable for the location but Internet at 22 euro/day is a blatant ripoff (though you can get 30 minute vouchers for lobby use.) Decor is elegant, desk staff is helpful. Overall a good choice in central Barcelona, especially if you don't need internet. Obamabar next door has good selection of beers and BHO himself in residence for a discussion.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: gaynor p Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The position of this hotel could not be better-very central. Smart, clean, tidy. If there is one negative it is that the metro runs under the hotel and could disturb light sleepers. But I would return to this hotel and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DonnaHamps
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend city break. Great location within walking distance to La Rambla and metro station. The hotel was clean, fab art decor and friendly staff. Got a good deal on the hotel price with bookings.com Would stay again if we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...not very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: irishkid511
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Avenida Palace after returning from a cruise. The hotel is in a great location and for the most part was comfortable. The breakfast was very good - the waiters very accomodating. We ate dinner in the hotel one evening and the food was excellent. It is a bit strange for dinner however. They close the main dining room and set tables just outside it. There were 3 tables set - 2 were occupied. The waiters go in and out of the closed dining room to access the kitchen. It's kind of like eating on someone's front porch. Our real complaints did not begin until we were leaving the hotel. While the people at reception were never particularly friendly - or helpful - we didn't need them until we were leaving. As we exited the hotel to get into the taxi for the airport my mother's shoe became wedged under the revolving door. She was pushed to the ground in front of the hotel. There is no automatic stop on the door and at 94 she certainly couldn't stop it. She had a bad cut over her eye and was very bruised. The hotel staff seemed more interested in cleaning up the blood on their doorstep then in helping clean up their guest. One young lady - I'm sorry I did not get her name - did get us a chair and a towel but she was the only helpful one. So far their only comment has been that they are not responsible for the misuse of their facilities. I still can't figure out how walking through a revolving door is misuse??? I own my own travel business. I didn't make them aware of that while I was there - didn't see the need. I will not, however, book my clients there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vitsilvi
Reviews.Content: We spend our honeymoon at Avenida Palace in Barcelona in 2011. The hotel is very nice, clean and the stuff were helpful if you search an advice where to eat or to go. The hotel is placed in the centre of Barcelona at directly next of the Metro Station of Passeig de Gracia, very near from La Rambla and Plaza Catalunya. So if you decide to go by bus there, at the airport are blue busses they take you directly to Plaza Catalunya and then 2 streets (about 10-15min walk) is the hotel situated. Our room was spacious, clean, it had 2 TV and a large bathroom. Made came every days. We had a nice view over the city as we were at a higher floor. In the night you only feel the metro passing underneeth the hotel as it trembles slightly but this is not the hotel's fault. The room was very warm even the bathroom was very warm as we went in January and those days were quite cold. Near from them are a lot of restaurants and tapa bars and some pubs you can spend your nights. The funny was that in Janurary we went all was closing at 12 o clock in the night so if you go in the winter make sure you go out early :-). In general we had a very pleasant stay at the hotel and one I thing I liked, you could go from the hotel everywhere very easily due to the perfect position.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: dimitrisbAthens
Reviews.Content: + excellent location, you cannot find a better one, close to la rambla ans next to passeig de gracias, 5' walk from casa batllo and 10 from la pedrera Great common areas But.... -unacceptable rooms. Broken toillet door, old and dirty carpet, old overused mattresses, terribly used bathroom sinks etc.m Overused furniture, un painted walls, Free wifi at reception was never there, it asked for 9 euro/day! Did i complain?? I dont do this anymore..i just do not return to the place.. Not friendly reception staff, when asked to recommend a good place for new years eve they recomended only their own gala dinner at 140 euro pp!! Unnacceptable from a four star hotel ! And everytime you would ask something they made you feel bad for disturbing... Junior suite in internet looked muc.h bigger than in reality...i wonder why... "stingy" attitude in everything..from room service in breakfast where they deliver three little bread rolls and three little butters for three guests..even toillet paper is "measured" Noisy rooms, no sound proof walls or doors.. You would wake up everytime anybody would leave or return. Finally, the price for this room was almost 300 euros per night!! I m sure many barcelona hotels are much better than this..

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: s1d972
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for my 4th visit to Barcelona in 18months. Out of all the hotels I have stayed in this hotel is superbly located and is a nice hotel - however they advertise free wifi in public areas (lobby) which is true, though hey don't mention you have to go to reception to get a voucher that gives you 30 minutes continual wifi from the momen you log on. This drove me bonkers since I could not check emails etc on the fly whilst walking through reception without having to get a voucher! This may seem trivial however as a company Director Internet access is imperative to keep in touch with my office. If you don't need wifi - great hotel, however I wouldn't stay here again unfortunately:-(

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Casey221
Reviews.Content: The Avenida Palace is a great old hotel in a perfect locaiton in Barcelona walking distance from many great attractions. Rooms were lovely and the buffet breakfast was very good. The reason for 4 and nto 5 stars- was it was a bit shabby and could use a face lift. All in all- an excfllent bet in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Pilotjohn
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently placed, with most of the major tourist attractions within walking distance. This hotel has an 'old wordly' feel - a friendly doorman, reception staff who appear to recognise you as you walk past, excellent breakfast buffet with waiters in dinner jackets. The basic room was clean, comfortable and reasonably quiet as it overlooked an enclosed space. The hotel allowed us an early check-in and a late check out. All in all, most agreeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: jtchapman
Reviews.Content: Once again. My travel agent is my good friend!! Stayed here as part of our Med cruise this year (June 2011). The hotel was excellant and in a great location. Walked across the esplanade and had tapas for dinner. A good start to our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: avabro
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. It was a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas, and within easy walking distance to many restaurants. We had a lovely room, and contrary to other Things we heard, the staff was quite friendly and helpful...AND free wi-fi in the lobby!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: nu74
Reviews.Content: Location, location and location again, could not be better. Hotel is located in the heart of the city, close to most of the attractions such as Plazza de Catalunya, cathedral, casa Mella and casa Battillo and so on, public transportation as well as "hop on hop off" buses and airport shuttle bus. The hotel itself is very clean, spacious, staff is courteous and helpful, provided all the info we needed for our travels. Our room was on the 3rd floor and it was pretty big and comfortable. it was cleaned every day, towels changed, toiletries provided. There are a lot of places to eat around the hotel so one does not have to have overpriced meals in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As Amazing as Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jnp27
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in a room overlooking the beautiful avenue the hotel is situated on (amazing location by the way) on the third floor, which meant we got to enjoy enormous rooms with balconies that allowed us the freedom of listening to the buzz of the beautiful city. The hotel is microseconds away from numerous delicious restaurants, tapas bars and great shopping (Zara is in breathing-distance). The only beef I had with this hotel was the breakfast - don't bother. It was super expensive and not very good. Besides that, this hotel has a posh, vintage European vibe. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very elegent, room 5*, beware noise from Metro!”
Reviews.Author: startraindd
Reviews.Content: We stayed on night post-cruise at the Avenida Palace, having booked through Priceline. First impressions upon arrival were outstanding. Doorman immediately whisked our luggage inside and as we arrived early, our bags were stored. When we reached our room in late afternoon, we were very pleasantly surprised. The room was more like a suite. Very large bath, and a king size (but very firm) bed. The hotel offers "Free" internet in the lobby, but only for 30 minutes. We were able to get a second code for an additional session, but 30 minutes, really? It really didn't bother us, but we did hear the Metro rumbling under the hotel from our room, on the "2nd floor" (but the second floor is really the fourth floor...) If you are a light sleeper, this may not be the best choice for you! We would stay there again as the public areas are great and the room much larger than expected. Location is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Kassi73
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and had a truly wonderful stay. Our room was spacious as we had a triple. Breakfast was delicious with the added benefit of staying open til late in the morning. One thing we hate about hotels is having to wake up especially to get to breakfast before the dining room closes. Not the case here, or indeed in Barcelona. Hotel is in a very central location to the shops on Pasio de Gracia and also couple of minutes walk from nearest station. Also near walking distance to Las Ramblas and the Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Dolphirefighter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in a very convenient location. Right across the street is an entrance to the metro, Casa Batllo is right down the street and numerous tapas restaurants are close by. It's a 5min or less walk to Palaca Catalunya. The hotel was beautiful when you first walked in. The staff greated us at the counter and initially we were told our room wasn't ready, but we asked to be placed into a street room, and they were very willing to accomadate us. The rooms are very simple, and the beds are lower than what we are use to, and a little harder than I'm use to as well, but I'm in a foreign country so.... everythings different than what I'm use to, and I'm humble enough to know that things in other countries just aren't the same as they are in the states. I can say that the bathroom was a lot bigger than most american hotels and resorts I stay in. The windows on the street view are double windows so you don't have to worry about the sound. I'm a light sleeper and never heard a sound. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DivaDO
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews before I left for spain with my girlfriends, I was really worried about my stay at this hotel. However it was fine. The hotel is extremely ornate and if you love mid-century wood furnishings, solid doors, lots of brass then you would love this hotel. My room was on the 9th floor overlooking the city and the mountains. It looked recently renovated and clean but dimly lit. On my arrival, initially I found the staff to be a bit cold while disseminating information however as the day progress, my group found that the hotel staff warmed to us and became more friendly and helpful as they probably found our attempt to speak spanish amusing. I must say Javier who was at the desk when we checked in and was there two days later when we checked out was the most helpful and patient with all our questions. The breakfast was included with our stay and it was an experience. We did not enjoy the selection but the dining room staff were the most friendly people we met on this vacation so we tried each day to find one food to love. The best thing about this hotel is the location to the museums, the shops, the tour bus and Las Ramblas. Being on the nineth floor did not stop me a surburban girl from hearing the underground train but if you are on the first floor it is worst. Keep in mind you are in a big city and you will hear the train along with other traffic sounds. If I was travelling to Barcelona again with my girlfriends I would probably stay here again because of the fact it is in a great location for the things I wish to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: yacov_e
Reviews.Content: We stay at hotel in Oct/2011. The location is very good, almost all Barcelona attraction are in wallking distance. Great tapas bar is just few steps from the hotel. A lot of restaurants and cafes are in the area. The room we got (family of 3) was very good. The reception desk sometimes provides wrong information about time of events in the city. Other then that the hotel is perfect. Free Wi-FI in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Pardfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in October 2011. Avenida Palace couldn't have a better location. It is just around the corner from the Ramblas. Shops, restaurants, street performers-it's all there. The very efficient Barcelona metro is conveniently located nearby.There is also a travel company that books day trips a couple of blocks away.The Avenida Palace is quite elegant with nice sized rooms and baths. Our bed was huge and very comfortable.The breakfast buffet has a large variety of items-you won't go hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mer0406
Reviews.Content: After a 12 day cruise my husband and I stayed at the Hotel Avenida Palace for 2 nights. It was very convenient to the bus routes and to La Rambla. It was within walking distance. The room was spacious and we had a corner room with a balcony so it was very nice. It was very comfortable. The decor was exquisite. The front desk personnel were very helpful with directions and ideas for meals. It was close to some very good Tapas restaurants too. The free breakfast was plentiful and had a lot to choose from although it wasnt that tasty! We enjoyed our stay there and would recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “pretensions of grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Ritter-Writer
Reviews.Content: This hotel relies on some of its public areas to keep it - just about - in it's 4 star category. But when you delve a little deeper, this is what you find: 1. The room mini bar has soft drinks only, and their prices are unacceptably high. 2. The furniture in my single room (though I imagine it could be used as a double, since it has a double bed) was very basic, as were the fittings in the bathroom. 3. The toiletries on offer were the minimum acceptable. 4. The so-called "business corner" has just 2 computers and is unmanned. The charges for using one are ridiculously high. If this had been a two star category hotel, I would have given it three or even four stars for effort on this site. But as an official four star hotel, it relies on past glories, mass tourism and is not a particularly agreeable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1964_11
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay in Barcelona for a couple of nights before we went on a cruise. Did this all through the cruise company NCL and they put us in this hotel. Lovely hotel, great location. We stayed as B & B guests, the first morning a woman was in charge within the breakfast room and was totally hopeless seemed to have no idea what was going on and the queue to get a table was long with an approximate wait of about 15-20 mins. On the second day it was thankfully totally different. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was lovely and spacious and the bed was lovely and comfortable. Decor was also very nice, clean and pleasant. Location was brilliant. For sightseeing this can be done on foot (wear comfy shoes) or the Metro which is not far away or via the hop on hop off tourist buses which have 3 different routes one of which will even take you to Nou Camp. 22 euros per adult valid for whole day.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm in great location”
Reviews.Author: WWwalker
Reviews.Content: We were close enough to the action without being in the old town with the crowds. Walking distance to Casa Batllo, La Rambla and Passeig de Gracia on the corner. The comments about the subway below -- you couldn't hear anything but you could feel the rumbling. Certainly did not keep us up at night. Rooms were clean and spacious, breakfast was decent and make sure to look up and down the beautiful staircase.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Everything”
Reviews.Author: AlanandSally
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in September 2011 as an add-on to a Royal Caribbean cruise which began in Barcelona. I would agree with all the previous comments about the excellent location of this hotel - close enough to walk to the major attractions but far enough away from them to get a good night's sleep. The staff all seemed to be older and although courteous and efficient were a little on the formal side for us - a few smiles would have lightened the mood! We had a room on the 9th floor (with an uninspiring view of the rooftop smoking area of the building next door) which was functional rather than comfortable, although to be fair it was very clean. The very impressive lobby and public rooms as you enter the hotel are sadly not reflected in the rest of the building which is somwhat tired and gloomy. Breakfast was included in our booking and was of a decent standard but I'm not sure it was worth €17. There are plenty of good alternatives within a short walk of the hotel. It was also disappointing to find limited (and expensive) WiFi on offer at the hotel - if you need occasional access to ctach up on emails etc, there is an excellent Starbucks 2 minutes' walk away towards Placa De Catalunya which has free WiFi, great air conditioning and good coffee - a much better option than the hotel! All in all, the Avenida was okay as a place to sleep after a day's sightseeing in the city but I wouldn't really want to spend more than a couple of days there. We may stay there again if visiting Barcelona but only if we are unable to find somewhere more modern, friendly and welcoming. Any suggestions gratefully received!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: rentiu
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with a great location in a safe area of Barcelona. The hotel stuff is very nice and accomodating. There is free wireless in the hotel lobby for 30 min increments, but if you need to stay longer, they will give you as many 30 min increments you need. The hotel is situated 1/2 a block away from Passeig de Gracia with its wonderful shops, 1/2 a block away from Rambla de Cataluna, which becomes La Rambla and only 1 block away from a El Corte Inglés supermarket. Also around the corner from the hotel is one of the best tapas bar in Barcelona - The Ciudad Condal Bar. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and if we go back to Barcelona I will definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Right out of Stephen King's the Shining”
Reviews.Author: lshattuck
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel when our flight was cancelled due to Hurricane Irene. We spent 3 nights. The facade and the lobby are gorgeous. The rest of the hotel smells old and musty. The hallways are dark and creepy. We kept waiting for Danny to ride around a corner on his big wheel. You could hear other guests and staff through the walls. The staff could not be bothered to assist with questions about sites/tours. They were rude and short with the guests. The breakfast was HORRIBLE. Skipped it the second two mornings.

Reviews.Title: “A very different robbery style at Avenida Palace”
Reviews.Author: miedos
Reviews.Content: Im a travel agent staff and we, our family, parents and 2 kids wanted to stay at Avenida Palace. I knew this hotel with its good location and nice pictures. We drove with my family from Madrid, were very tired and as i know this hotel, we checked in he hotel. The receptionist said" will offer a suit at a very good rate, half rate" I accepted the rate and room and we stayed that night. Tomorrow, they said" have to change our rooms not suit but again connecting room and half rate". I said ok and we changed our room. We stayed in that room 3 nights and last day, they again said have to change our rooms because we will check out very early morning. But this time, not half price a full price will be applied because the hotel is full. I accepted and changed our room to a very small room. When i was trying to check out early in the morning at 02:00 AM, the receptionist printed my bill and i saw about 1,500 EUR just for 4 nights ! Not applied our rate, full rate and 2 rooms we have been applied for connecting rooms. I showed my checkin card and showing our rate but he says "i have to pay the bill and without paying not let check-out !" The receptionist cant explain my checkin card writing down there exactly the price, because im a travel agent staff but request me to pay about 1,500 EUR, per night about 400 EUR !!!!! I insisted him to call the police then he said if i sign something i can check out paying my original invoice. I signed a paper; paid in full invoice and luckily checked our and hurried to catch our flight. Before going to Barcelona somebody warned us "robbery, taxi drivers and hotel staff". I didnt care about all but faced with the same at Avenida Palace ! This is a kind of professional robbery ! I deeply advise you: be careful with your rate, everytime request your bill as written and never trust them if they say to you "yes ok, everything is ok" Additionally, you cant open the windows as of terrible sounds; breakfast is just cheese and egg; we stayed different 3 rooms and all are smiling very bad, without opening the window you cant take breath ! Just go to Rambla street and pay even the half price for a very good and clean 4* hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: ShlomoYokneam_Israel
Reviews.Content: The hotels interior pictures on the web are not misleading, it really looks like a palace. However, the rooms are simple, functional and match the hotel's ranking, I know nothing about the price as it came as part of a travel deal. Nothing from the beutiful interior goes into the room which is a pitty, our room was very clean, had a view to nowhere, the underground runs below but if you are in the third floor it doesn't matter, the bathroom was very clean and looked newly renovated. Breakfast buffet was nice, and rich compared to hotels in other european cities.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in town.”
Reviews.Author: George P
Reviews.Content: The biggest asset for this hotel is its location. Located in one of the best places in the city for tourists and businessmen. A stone's throw from the main city square. Near several metro stations and bus stations and tourist information office. The staff and facilities are impeccable, as well as the scrambled eggs at breakfast. The rooms are spotless and the bathroom is shining. I found a bit too much the almost daily change of towels. It is not necessary and non environmental. They did their utmost to make our stay as comfortable as possible. The only minus is the elevator; it takes a long time to get to.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet place with a good breakfast and wi fi.”
Reviews.Author: savage416
Reviews.Content: We booked through Gala hotels and it was about $180 for three people with breakfast.We had jet lag but even though the hotel was extremely busy they checked our bags early and recommended a nice place for lunch. The air worked great and it was so quiet we slept for 10 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: maura_c_c
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel recently with 15 family members and we enjoyed our visit. Great location in central Barcelona. Tapas resturant accross the street was a big hit. The room we stayed in was a triple and was spacious - as was the bathroom. In fact by European standards, our bathroom was huge!!! Full breakfast buffet was served every morning. It was ok. Some hot food like bacon and eggs, but the quality was so so. The day we go there, we at lunch at a Tapas resturant accross the street. It was a big hit. Great variety and the kids even all loved it!! Plenty of resturants and shops all around!! It was an easy walk to La Rambas, and quite an easy cab ride to where ever else you wanted to be! They have a doorman who always got us 5 cabs in minutes whenever we were going out! I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby and location, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: marathonbird
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel my husband and I stayed in while in Barcelona for our honeymoon. Upon entering the hotel we noticed the very ornate lobby and expected the rest of the hotel to be just as nice - unfortunately we were disappointed. Our room was very small and the view from our window was of another wall of the hotel. After our first day when our room was cleaned housekeeping took our towels and never replaced them, and also didn't give us new shampoo and body gel to replace the ones we had used. The location of the hotel is great, as it's literally right in front of a metro stop, but other than that, this hotel is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Old style elegance with disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: LordSmudge
Reviews.Content: Visited at a very quiet time of year, hotel probably only a third full but still allocated an inner courtyard, upper storey room - why do hotels treat single travellers so abominably? The room was really really dark, and faced into a service courtyard, and the view was just other rooms, why when the hotel is so empty do they put people in the worst rooms. The room itself was big, the bed could have accomodated the Barcelona football team, and the marble bathroom was well equippped. Great buffet breakfast, but the male only staff were reticent to serve, and a tad servile and slow when they were asked for anything. The hotel is very grand and could be fabulous and although it looked sumptuous the quality of service was non existent and really let it down. However I also found the level of service across Barcelona was very poor in general, may explain the current economic crisis, they just don't seem to value the tourist who has come to visit their city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location outweight by poor roooms and lousy service”
Reviews.Author: sssammmy
Reviews.Content: From the outside and the lobby area, this hotel looks like a 4 star hotel, but the rooms are small we stayed at room 304 even though a junior suite was reserved for us. Staff is rude except for a nice manager who helped us with planning our sightseeing and the reception clerk who checked us out and helped us with suitcases. We called the last night and asked for a bottle of shampoo as the service staff had not replenished it when they made to room, it never arrived. Once my wife held the door open for me as we had a stroller with a baby, and the door man just walked through the door, while my wife was holding it open. Our rooms window opened into a wall so no light in interior rooms. The location is great...minutesto las ramblas and right on la rambla catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, and extremely helpful staff with a reservation problem that was not their fault.”
Reviews.Author: jeffg600
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Avenida Palace in Barcelona for a 3 night stay prior to a cruise. The hotel itself was quite nice. We had 5 people in 2 rooms, a triple junior suite and a double. The rooms were typical, nice European hotel rooms with all of the amenities that you would expect. It's not a luxury hotel, but it is very nice and very good value. The junior suite was more spacious than a standard room, with a small sitting area when a third bed was able to be set up. The beds were comfortable and everything was clean and well maintained. The location is excellent. The one area of special mention that I want to make is how the reception staff helped us with a reservation problem. Our travel agent made a mistake on the dates of our reservation (not the hotel's fault) so they didn't have us in their system for the date we arrived. Imagine our concern, having flown through the night with 3 kids and arriving in a busy hotel with no record of us coming. The hotel staff worked hard to accommodate us and in a couple of hours they were able to have rooms for us. I considered that service to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “City Break Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Andyfatowl
Reviews.Content: The service we received was very good. Had left a few toiletries at home having flown Ryanair. Asked for directions to chemist but the hotel offered the items instead. The room was a reasonable size and the bed very comfortable. The hotel was brilliantly located for the centre of town so a great base for sightseeing. Have no qualms recommending and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bergmom2010
Reviews.Content: The Avenida Palace was recommended to us for its location. It is in a very nice location. Convienent to the Red double decker bus line, good restaurants (2 tapas places in walking distance), and shopping. The Gaudi houses are within walking distance as is Las Ramblas. The hotel is older and in need of renovations. We had 2 connecting rooms, which were spacious. The hair dryers did not work in either room, and the towels were horrible. The beds were not very comfortable, and the linens were terrible. All in all, it was expensive for what it was. Look for other hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyTravelers2
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel with our travel agent prior to leaving the US, based on many positive reviews. The hotel is VERY nice with a large room and large bathroom. The staff is helpful and friendly. The traditional European breakfast buffet is generous with many hot and cold items. WIFI is free in the lobby for 30 minutes at a time. You can pay for wireless in your room on a per/minute basis (or package) but is expensive - 22 euros for 24 continous hours. The hotel is located in a great location, convenient to many of the Barcelona landmarks (Las Ramblas, Gothic Quarter, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: CuriousSerbia
Reviews.Content: The location is central, so it was really easy to reach each place you wanted to see and to come back just as easily whenever you want a break (or when you need to leave all those shopping bags...) The room was not too spacious (cca 25m2), but enough for just the two of us. It was kept very clean throughout our visit. However, we had no view whatsoever, because the only window we had faced other windows on the other side, divided only by a 3-5m space between them. You could see the sky above, but the noise from the air conditioning appliances from the outside kept us from opening the windows. The breakfast was nice, in a large baroque dining room with some paintings from the 19th century. In general, the hotel is an OK 4-star, with a bit kitschy inside decoration, but the location definitely deserves 5-stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADM1953
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Avenida Palace and would have to say that the accomodation was excellent. Whilst our room had no view to speak of, it was roomy, quiet and spotlessly clean. The hotel itself is beautifully fitted out and well located in walking distance to Le Rambla and all of the sites of Barcelona. Staff are excellent - helpful & knowledgeable. The breakfast buffet is the best we encountered through our whole trip - excellent range, quality & service. Overall, I would certainly recommend Avenida Palace if you are visiting Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “A fancy lobby and central location, but only average accommodations, weak food, and disinterested service.”
Reviews.Author: ADGrantley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Avenida Paace in Barcelona for three nights in June 2011. The hotel bills itself as "3 star," but 2 is closer to the mark. There was no doorman; I was warned not to put my hand luggage down on the sidewalk in front of the door for a minute because it might be stolen even as I stood over it. Our room faced a narrow alley and an office building, so it was impossible to open the window for air or light. The hall was dim and tired looking; the room was poorly lighted. O the first day we received one small cube of soap and were given no more during our three day visit. No Kleenex in the room. Cracked floor tiles and water stains on the ceiling by the door. All requests for service at the front desk were met with grudging attention. And every minute or two, the Metro trains running under or near the foundation of the hotel shook the room enough to show ripples in a glass of water--I felt like we were living near the El. I would not return or recommend that anyone else stay at the Avenida Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Property”
Reviews.Author: BonnieL0789
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in April of 2009 and I have intended to write this review ever since. I am a cruise agent and recommend this property frequently to my clients due to accommodations and location. We booked a three night stay at the end of a transatlantic cruise in a Junior Suite. It was wonderful. The room clean with a sleeping chamber plus a sitting room. Bath was large with double vanity sinks, tub/shower, toilet and bidet. Keep in mind most European properties do not have wash cloths and if you want a face cloth, carry one with you. The beds were comfortable and our room faced the main street. Location is perfect with a Metro station within 100 yeards and within walking distance of Catalunya Square and Las Ramblas. Breakfast was buffet and adequate. While there is a restaurant on property, I suggest seeking out other restaurant opportunities, perhaps on the Las Ramblas for evening. This a a property I would not hesitate returning to.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Old World Charm in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: premalz
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and venture out into the city as everything is so close from here. The area is quite upmarket and accessibility to the hotel from various tourist points is very good. If you are driving down, you will have to pay a steep rate, as the hotel does not have its own parking. Our junior suite was fantastic, a lovely relaxing and cosy couch with a good flat screen TV and a table and chairs formed one room, and a large bed in the other room. The bathroom was very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Get Too Comfortable....”
Reviews.Author: goodogg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenida Palace in Barcelona for the final 4 nights of an eighteen day tour through France and Spain. I was traveling with a group of about 30 people who were staying at the Hotel Colon in Barcelona, we chose the Barcelona Palace so that we could book a more spacious room. It was very interesting to be able to compare the two hotels. Both are beautiful and both are in excellent locations. The Barcelona Palace is very beautiful, clean and has an "old world" style to it. We spoke with the gentelmen at the front desk many times and they were professional but not particularly friendly. They never went out of their way to say one more word than was required or to offer much in the way of recommendations. I would not say that we were treated warmly. Our room was spacious and clean but I kept thinking that the hotel's motto should be "don't get too comfortable" because of it's coolness. We did have a junior suite which offered a bedroom and a sitting room, like a small apartment - that was great as we had a rather large amount of luggage. The bathroom was clean and had dual sinks, which I always appreciate. I noticed right away that they had provided us with shampoo and body wash as the only bath products and just 2 bath towels. We asked at the front desk to see if hari conditioner and body lotion were available and they said they were not but that we could purchase them at the salon in the lobby. This is not an inexpensive hotel and this just didn't seem like the right answer to me. We got a similar reply when we asked where we could find a local market to purchase drinking water. We were told to use the mini bar. Again, not a good answer. Because we were showering twice a day, we had to request that additional towels be delivered each day....you would think that they would just make sure that 4 bath towels were provided to save themselves the trouble of having to run additional towels up to the rooms. We requested ice on two occasions (there is no icemaker) instead of bring an ice bucket as most hotels would do, we reveived a small bowl of ice the first time and a plate of ice the second time. Again, this response just seemed strange. The beds were firm as were the pillows, but not as uncomfortable as I was afraid they would be. Although we had requested a king suite, the king was made with two twin beds next to each other. This is common in Europe, but typically they will use a bumper of sorts to fill in the gap between the 2 mattresses....but no, we are in the hotel that doesn't want you to get too comfortable and we found that the twin beds were made up individually and the sheet on the center side of each bed was tucked into it's respective mattress so deeply and firmly that it was nearly impossible to touch any part of the person sleeping in the other bed - it was as if we were being swaddled. Additionally, only one of the two beds had a blanket, I spent the first two nights with just sheet covering me - yup, it's that comfort thing.... We visited our friends room at the Hotel Colon and found that this hotel was also in an excellent location, perhaps better than the Barcelona Palace because it would have less motor traffic. The atmosphere was much lighter and more comfortable, less old world formality. I asked my friends if their bathroom amenities had been sparce and learned that they were given every amenity imagineable including sewing kits....I asked about their bed configuration and was told that the beds were full kings with no swaddling involved....the rooms at the Hotel Colon had floor to ceiling shutters that were just beautiful and all in all, that hotel was much more comfortable and inviting. bottom line is that if I was going to be in Barcelona again, I would stay at the Hotel Colon or perhaps at the Hotel Crystal Palace which was in a lovely little neighborhood around the corner from the Barcelona Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: dreww13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located on Grand Via, just steps from the Metro stop and a very short walk to Las Ramblas. The rooms were a little small but the price was very good and it was still very comfortable with 2 twin beds. The staff was very nice and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby but service,cordiality and quality stop there.”
Reviews.Author: dcburns619
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel on April 24, 25,2011. We had stayed in the Avenida Palace in Lisbon and it was a clear *****experience. In Barcelona we had booked a "deluxe Double"at the Avenida Palace assuming it would be just as nice as in Lisbon. (We later learned that although they had the same name there was no relationship-) The bedroom was extremely small 8x10 and the bathroom was so small if you used the toilet your knees ended up under the sink. I want back to the desk and asked what class room we were given. I was told it was a regular double. I went back to the room and got my confirmation and showed it to the desk again. Reponse: "Oh yes you have a deluxe double". I asked for an explanation and was told it was all marketing issues. I ask the desk represntative to come and see my room. She was very unfriendly but I persisted and she came. I asked to see other double deluxe rooms and after some discussion I was shown two---both bigger and nicer than ours. I would never stay there again....the staff is haughty, rooms classifications are quite arbitrary. Finally I was told by rhe desk clerk that that the room classification is a nightmare and she wished management would solve it and not put her in such a difficult position. I was offered another room, but we were leaving early the next morning and did not want the hassle. I had already wasted too much of my time. Finally let me say the people we met in Barcelona were kind and very nice. Unfortunately they didn't work at our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Dcdom
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently took a trip two-week trip to London, Paris and Barcelona. This was our favorite hotel on the trip, and we stayed at two very nice Marriotts in London and Paris. What sets this hotel apart is its fantastic location. It's a very quick walk to Las Ramblas, a major thoroughfare that leads to vendors, artists, and the ultimate fresh food market, the Boqueria. You can also easily walk to two major architectural works by Gaudi - Casa Mila and Casa Batllo. The hotel is located in the Eixample, Barcelona's shopping district, which means you are surounded by just about every type of shop you can imagine. And around the corner is one of the best tapas restaurants in the city - Tapas 24. We ate there twice in four nights. Finally, it's a short walk to two metro stops. The inside of the hotel is lovely. My partner, who is in the hotel industry, calls it "classic 1940s." A giant spiral staircase leading to the guest rooms, banisters of gold filigree, blue carpeting, and white walls with marble accents. We were happy with the service, but can see why other people had complaints about it. This is not the kind of hotel where doormen, bell hops and other staff are practically tripping over themselves to say hello or offer assistance. For example, we weren't offered any help with our bags at check-in or check-out, which is pretty unusual for a hotel of this caliber. This didn't really bother us, but we noticed. I like to call this kind of service "unobtrusive." Having said that, the people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful whenver we asked for anything. The housekeeping staff kept our room clean. The wait staff in the dining room was friendly and efficient. We booked our room to include a breakfast buffet every morning, and it was worth it in my opinion. The hotel seems to cater to a lot of American tourists, so the buffet serves a lot of American breakfast dishes (scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, etc.) and some traditional Barcelona fare (Iberico ham, egg tortillas, etc.) We would eat a big breakfast to prepare ourselves for a day of walking and sight seeing, eat a small lunch, and engorge ouselves on tapas in the evenings. A note about the elevators: They are extremely slow. We tried waiting for them a couple times (once we had our bags and were checking out), but we lost patience. We were on the third floor, so it was easy to take the stairs and it was a good way to walk off all those tapas. I recommend staying away from the higher floors unless you want a good climb several times a day, or you have a good book to read while waiting for the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star quality”
Reviews.Author: Ajandmuffpuff
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, but that is the only thing positive about our stay. The reception staff was aloof to the point of rude. We were there for two nights and room service never did show up. The in-room Internet cost 22 euros per 24 hrs. the major complaint was our bed. our travel agent had booked a "standard double" as they did for the other 5 stops on our tour of Europe. The hotel's idea of a double bed was to push two twin beds together. The mattresses were uncomfortable. We were glad to be leaving. If our stay in Barcelona had been any longer we would have changed hotels. Will not return to this hotel and will suggest our agent not refer clients there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliantly Situated”
Reviews.Author: sandrawarner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated right close to Las Ramblas with street entertainers and fantastic restaurants and bars. The staff are friendly and welcoming and the breakfast was good value with lots of choice. We stayed with 14 of our closest friends and some of their rooms were light and airy, ours was a bit dark but big enough for 2 with lots of storage and a nice bathroom. It was quiet although on a busy road and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOBARRETT1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avendia Palace from 18th - 21st March and were a group of 9 women celebrating a birthday. I can say this hotel was perfect, very nice, clean hotel and the rooms were also excellent, there were 3 of us in a room on the 9th floor and we were given a junior suite so had plenty of room. The room was also cleaned every day. The location was also perfect just across the road from ramblas but far enough away so we didn't hear any of the noise from ramblas. The beach was about a 30 min walk away but you can walk down ramblas to it. I also have to give special mention to Javier the deputy manager who was brilliant and helped us with any queries we had he also booked us a table at a restaurant on our friends actual birthday as we wanted something special but wasn't too sure where to go so thank you Javier!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Attleborotraveller Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very good value for money, especially as it was situated in the centre of the city, near the Rambles. We arrived at about 11.30am, and were able to check in straight away. Our rooms were on the 8th floor so we were not disturbed by any noise from the metro, althouhg you could have faint rumblings when in the hotel bar/restaurant. The rooms were adequate in terms of space, with decent sized bathrooms and large comfortable beds. The only down side was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities. The breakfast was average - a good choice of pastries, cheeses and cold meats - but we were not too impressed with the sausage, bacon and scambled eggs. We did not eat dinner at the hotel as we were out and about with plenty of bars & restaurants nearby. The reception staff were polite and helpful (Finding out times of buses and airport transfers for us), and despite only staying 2 nights our rooms were cleaned on the 2nd day. Overall I would recommend this hotel as a good hotel, very good vale for money, and in a perfect location to explore Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: anglian
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights early march fantastic location on the door step of las ramblas first impressions on entering hotel was that it is very ornate and pleasing on the eye, the next part is the only grump i had about the hotel the reception staff are not the most cheerfull people you will ever meet and it all seemed an effort to deal with us, elsewhere in the hotel the staff where very friendly and helpfull especially the luggage man. the room we had room 601 was a triple and very large,clean and had everything you needed no complaints there,breakfast was better than i expected with plenty of hot and cold to choose from . the hotel is very clean all over and i would not hesitate to recommend or book this hotel again, outside you will find some fantasic tapas bars right on your door step and great restaurants, barcelona is a fantastic city to visit but just have your wits about you when walking around las ramblas

Reviews.Title: “superb peaceful location two minutes from Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Moira84
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful, rooms are an excellent size, spotlessy clean , great shower in the bathroom ,The beds have lovely freshly ironed ,crisp cotton sheets and thick pillows-fantastic ! Safe in room free.Breakfast was excellent in the modern restaurant ,continental with a great choice of lovely breads.meats and fruits ,also cooked bacon and eggs .Very central for shopping , Las Ramblas,bus tours-Will definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Beautiful Historical Interior. Lackluster Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SCauwels
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Avenida Palace on business. The location is simply wonderful. You are at the center of the city and I was able to walk to almost all the historical and architectural sites that I wished. The building was in great shape as well as the rooms. My room was on the interior with no natural light but was very quiet for great sleeping. The big complaint I had was the cost for 24hrs of internet in your room was 17euro ($24). For a business traveller, this expense was most ridiculous. The internet was free in the lobby but you had to get a new access code from the front desk every half hour and could only access up to 1.5 hrs. Less expensive hotels in the allow you to access the internet for free. Finally, the staff, with the exception of 1 front desk lady, was not especiallly friendly. They could do so much better if they had more positive interactions with the customer. They acted as if they didnt want to be bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: charlene3c
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Christmas holidays, which is our second experience with the Avenida Palace. The location is fantastic and the hotel is exceptionally clean. I particularly appreciate the fact that the bathrooms have tubs and not just showers. Staff has always been professional and helpful. The buffet breakfast, while not inexpensive, is an excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, hotel staff and reception not so fantastic”
Reviews.Author: gsg1010
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon and so looking forward to arriving at our hotel, the company we booked with had informed the hotel the day before our arrival that it was our honeymoon. When we arrived at reception there were 2 staff 1 female and 1 male, neither of them said hello they just took our details and passports. Even when they handed us our room key, we still didn't get a hello or congratulations. Very rude! However the room itself was clean and comfortable, but I think the reason why its a 4 star is because of its location. We were about 50 - 100m from Las ramblas which is absolutely fantastic and the heart and soul of barcelona. Barcelona is our favourite city we adore it but next time we wil try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently decorated hotel, however reception and bar staff a little indifferent.”
Reviews.Author: PaulEGaston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotelover the Christmas period. It is situated near Passeig de Gracia and La Placa da Catalunya; excellent transport links. The hotel itself is decorated to a high standard and retains many of its original Victorian features with an ornate brass staircase and sympathetic furnishings. Breakfast is excellent with a wide selection on offer, however a little pricey at €20.00. The hotel is surrounded by lively bars, pubs and restaurants, which is just as well as buying a drink in the residents' bar can be something of a drawn-out performance. This said, it was an enjoyable and relaxing stay

Reviews.Title: “Good location.....but”
Reviews.Author: 41kailua
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small, and even though I requested a quiet room that was not the case. The bathroom was not attractive with very limited amenities and only two towels which were dingy white and the opposite of fluffy. Service was not very friendly, and we had to wait to store our luggage. The lobby is attractive and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful week in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: coreen611
Reviews.Content: WE spent a wonderful wek in Barcelona .The Avenida Hotel was just perfect a very good location everything is nearby in walking distance the metro right outside . The rooms are very clean and comfy. Breakfast too was very good maybe a lettuce leaf would be nice. Around the corner is a super Tapas place "cuitat comtal". with grea tfood and sangaria. Barcelona is a wonderful city and the hotel made our stay even better

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, clean and comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: TNHoneymooners_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first night of our honeymoon, and the staff went out of their way to make it special. The manager helped us pick a spot for dinner and made our reservations, he also sent up a bottle of champagne to our room. The hotel was easy to get to by bus from the airport and was right near the La Rambla market, the Gaudi house, and the subway station. The rooms were clean and we even got a king bed -- something I understand I learned was quite rare as our trip went on. This was a great place to start our stay in Barcelona and our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: buck002
Reviews.Content: 4 star hotel in a great location confortable clean excellent service and good buffet breakfast included in the rate. next to an excellent tapas bar cuitat comtal.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ebarnea
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the things we found were not that good... Breakfast was lacking vegetables. Internet is free only in the lobby area and expires every 30 min. after which one has to request a new username & password.The free session is also limited to 50 mb. but it was enough for my skype calls made from my mobile phone. Service was good but not anything beyond that. We stayed in a room that wasn't facing outwards and therefore had no view - it was also quite dark but it was very quiet. The bed was very wide (around 2 m.) & comfortable. Public spaces & room were all very clean There is a safe deposit in the room & it's free. There's also a minibar but we had no use of it so nothing to say about it apart from its' existance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, service just okay, room a bit worn.”
Reviews.Author: Cheskabrit
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the photos of this hotel on line and it's perfect location just steps from the Rambla. My actual experience was a bit of a let down. Service was not bad, it just didn't "Wow" me like I would have expected. Reception staff was pleasant enough, but not pleased I was checking in at 1:00 p.m. (before the acceptable check-in time of 4:00 pm). They had to see if a room could be available. Not the most welcoming. They also wouldn't budge on a slightly later check out (1 hour) so I could make time for a tour of Parc Guell the following morning. I was told it was "not possible". The room was spacious and comfortable with lots of closet space, a large window overlooking the street - that opened!!, a flat screen TV and seperate bath. The hall opened into a small vestibule leading to the bathroom. There is a seperate door into the room itself. The lighting was poor, though, and the lampshades were scorched. It was very difficult to read in the dim light. There were rust stains on the carpet from the wastebasket. Not the quality I would expect. The bathroom amenities were practically non-existant. Only a small shampoo, bar of soap and a gel dispenser. Not exactly 4-star plush. No robes, slippers or nice toiletries were offered. Wi-Fi is only free in the lobby and there is a 30 minute limit. When I asked about printing a boarding pass I was directed to the business center (2 pcs in a small area in a lower level). I was told it was "downstairs" and not given any further explanation. I had to wander around a bit before I found the room - again, another example of the reception staff being just not that helpful. I was not pleased to see it was a pay per minute set up where I had to register my credit card and pay per minute and per copy made. Come on. How cheap can you get? I had to charge $3 to my credit card to print the pass. Ridiculous and insulting. They can't even comp a single copy and brief internet access to guests?? The common areas are gorgeous, no doubt. Very impressive. Too bad the rooms and the service don't measure up.

Reviews.Title: “Bug Palace”
Reviews.Author: 2honeymooners2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and decided to end the trip by spending a few days in sunny Barcelona. The Avenida Palace seemed perfect because of its great location, however the staff failed to mention that the hotel has a little (sic, big) bug problem... The hotel is aware of the infestation and it’s a disgrace that they continue to book guests into their rooms, charging steep 4-star prices, when they know the rooms are full of bedbugs. We are itchy, irritated and absolutely irate because hotel management doesn’t seem to care about the welfare of their guests at all. Hopefully none of those bloodsuckers hitchhiked home with us. What a horrible way to end your honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the Bed Bugs Bite!”
Reviews.Author: cjones1455
Reviews.Content: This hotel has for the most part received good reviews in the past mainly for its excellant location. Unfortunately our room was infested with bed bugs and yes we were bitten numeous times. When reported there did not seem to be a great concern and thirty days later we have not heard a word from this four star hotel as far as an apology etc. We also had a reservation to spend an additional night at this hotel prior to returning home and tried to cancel the reservation and was told that because it was booked through Expedia that the reservation was non-cancellable. I guess we were expected to return and provide another meal for there unwanted guests. Avoid this hotel at all costs, unless you don't mind being bitten.

Reviews.Title: “Old-world comfort with modern conveniences”
Reviews.Author: TravelInsuranceLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel, just off the stylish Passeig de Gracia, has everything the business or leisure traveler could desire - good-sized rooms with every amenity (except free wi-fi; wi-fi is available, but you have to pay for it), excellent and varied buffet breakfast in a beautiful dining room, capable staff, and reasonable prices. They took excellent care of me and my clients, and I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a find”
Reviews.Author: mrspaper
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona after a 4 night stay in Madrid. The trip from the airport on the Airport bus was a breeze and cost 5 E. From the last bus stop at P. Catalyuna, you walk up about 2 blocks and make a left on Gran Via. The hotel is then right in front of you. If you can walk 2 blocks with luggage, no need to pay for a taxi. The hotel was convenient to the metro, which was easy to use. If you purchase a T-10 ticket, it is good for 10 rides and can be used by several people. It is also good on the bus. If you need to transfer from the metro to the bus and continue in the same direction within an hour, you scan the card and it doesn't cost anything additional. It is simple to purchase at the metro machines (they can not be purchased on the bus). The room wasn't ready when we arrived early in the morning, but they held our luggage while we went out for the day. It is a popular pre and post cruise hotel, so they luggage area got quite busy on cruise days. The beds were very comfortable, as were the pillows. We had adjoining rooms with our adult children. There is a nice size safe in the room, although you would not be able to fit a laptop in. Closet space was plentiful. There is a refrigerator in the room with a mini-bar. We had a room at the back of the hotel, and the metro noise was barely noticeable and not bothersome at all. We didn't bring our laptops, but they offer free connections in the lobby only. They also have a business center, but charge for internet. We had tapas next door to the hotel at Cuidad Contal, which is good, but expensive. It's a nice treat and one of the better, more popular tapas places. There is a wait, anytime of day. We grabbed sandwiches a few times across the street from the hotel at Farga. I recommend the salmon sandwich. There is a supermarket in the basement of El Corte Ingles, where we purchased wine and some other odds and ends. It was strange paying for different items at different places. You can eat at the top of El Corte Ingles, but we didn't check it out. Breakfast in the hotel was good, with a combination of meats, cheese, a variety of breads, eggs, desserts and a wonderful fruit salad. They were accomodating and made eggs over. I thought my camera memory card was taken, but I had misplaced it. The staff took it seriously and checked into it. I felt terrible. Front desk staff, Dorian, originally from Wales was the most helpful. He shared information on how to get to various places, and checked our flight information for us. One of the other gentlemen would not check our flight info without seeing our ticket, but with email, who has tickets these days. We were "lucky" enough to be in Barcelona during the countrywide general strike. Some of the staff were off and other staff slept over. Although they worked with minimal staff, it was hard to notice the difference in service. The only thing we couldn't get were our eggs over. Javier, the general manager/owner, was worried for his staff during the strike and was often found standing in front of the hotel. He joined us for a glass of Sangria before heading home to his family when the strike was over. He also slept at the hotel during the strike. During the strike, was walked La Rambla to the end and hung out at the port. It's about a 20 minute walk, but barely noticeable, since you stop along the way. Once at the port, you didn't even know there was a strike. It was very calm. At the beach, which we took the metro to and got off at Olympic Village, we visited Ice Barcelona. Access is from the beach. We had to ask several people until we found it. Outside, it is a regular bar. Never did an Ice Bar before, so it was an experience to try once. The hotel had brochures that gave 10% off, so it cost us 13.50 E admission, which included a drink. The girls only had sandals on, so when they got cold, they had an extra parka to throw over their feet. We felt safer walking around Barcelona than in Madrid, where twice, someone attempted to take our belongings while walking in the streets. Never once in Barcelona did we have an issue. Last time in Barcelona, I stayed at the Apsis Atrium Palace. I can make a few comparisons. They are located on the same street, The rooms in the Apsis Atrium Palace were more modern, they had a pool and jacuzzi in the basement. Breakfast at Avenida Palace was better, and I enjoyed my stay at Avenida more. I would not hesitate to recommend it and would definitely stay there again. If you plan to visit La Sagrada (a must), and Gaudi's house at Guell Parc, you can purchase a combo tix for 14 E, only at La Sagrada. If you purchase separately, it costs 3.50 E more. Guell Parc is also a must see. We took bus # 24 from the hotel to Guell Parc. It's more convenient than the Hop On-Hop Off bus, which we didn't use this time. The Ho-Ho bus lets you off at the bottom of the hill for Guell Parc and it's a nice walk up hill. The bus will also drop you at the bottom if you prefer, but I recommend continuing on the bus for a few more stops and get off at the top of the park and walk down. Most people still left on the bus will get off at the top, so you just walk with the crowd. It is a crowded bus, due to all the tourists, expect to stand. Going back to the hotel, we were able to pick up the bus by continuing to walk to the bottom of the street. Feel free to ask me any questions. I know there are many things I forgot to mention

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of it all!”
Reviews.Author: JLNairn0803
Reviews.Content: This could not have been in a better location! This was my first time to Barcelona, and I was traveling solo (female in her 20s). This hotel was in a safe location and less than 10 minutes from Las Ramblas. The staff were all SO nice, and gave fantastic advice! My room had tall ceilings and a king sized bed. It was a little hard for my liking, but that is a matter of personal preference. It did NOT have a view - my window was about 5 feel from someone's office. But, I also did not request one and booked this trip 4 days in advance. Breakfast was not included, and it was pretty pricey so that was disappointing. I enjoyed my stay there and have recommended it to several friends who have since booked their stays at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING”
Reviews.Author: Djulbars
Reviews.Content: we stay in hotel for 4 nights.,location is great,service is not bad, but they have BED BUGS

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: timmy1009
Reviews.Content: Located 5 min walk from the center, clean, nice, pro staff and good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in every way.”
Reviews.Author: pengu1n
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellently situated at the top of the ramblas. The decoration inside is impressive and the staff in the lobby and the dining room are friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was excellent and the waiters were particularly pleasant. We stayed in a junior suite which was perfect for our family with teenagers. The suite consisted of a spacious corridor leading to a double bedroom, a large bathroom and a sitting room/second bedroom. The rooms were clean and air conditioned. We were very pleased with this hotel, especially as our rooms were very reasonably priced and would recommend it as an excellent place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy iin Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: L2Y261
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenida Palace for two days before a Mediterranean cruise and three days after the cruise. We also had other family members stay on separate reservations. Our travel agent recommended the Avenida Place. We were all very happy with the hotel. The rooms were all renovated, clean, and spacious. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, especially the front desk staff. They were happy to advise us on places to see and restaurants to try. The hotel is at the very north tip of La Rambla.
