We walked La Rambla every day and had easy access to shops and restaurants, without the direct noise from the famous Barcelona nightlife. In addition, it was only a 20 minute walk to the ocean/beach. There are many famous landmarks within walking distance and we took advantage of the opportunity to see as much as we could. The accomodations and experience far exceeded our expectations for the rates we paid. It was not inexpensive, but it was not outrageously priced. For a downtown fine hotel, we felt we received a very good value. I would return to the Avenida Palace and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very good in any way”
Reviews.Author: shirik
Reviews.Content: great location ,very very friendly and helpfull staff in lobby helping in every question- very polite also in the dinning room. clean room but few briks were "dancing" under the carpet. good breakfast great aircondition. in the front of the hotel were scaffold but we didn't suffer any noice or dirt due to renovation. we absolutely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair room”
Reviews.Author: kdmc0408
Reviews.Content: For the price, it was fine. The location was great. We needed a clean place to sleep & shower ; it was clean but the bed was uncomfortable. The lobby was beautiful but it didn't carry over to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jiffydog75
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Barcelona in June 2010 and stayed for 3 nights at the Avenida Palace. The location was absolutely perfect. It is just steps away from the Ramblas, great shopping, and bus tours. We had a junior suite and it was very spacious. Our windows opened right out on to the boulevard. We could not have picked a better hotel to stay at while we were in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: kaybath
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very easy to find once off the Airport bus. Hotel in a great location, not right in the busy centre just 5 minutes off in a slightly quieter street. Looked quite grand from the outside and inside the same. We got to the hotel about 2pm and had to wait for 30mins to have our room. Reception staff quite ignorant. When i booked hotel i did ask for a nice room with a view as special birthday. The view we didn't get. The room was quite large but dark, barely any natural light. Big bathroom. All was clean but need updating with lick of paint! Very comfortable beds and towels changed everyday too. Breakfast wasn't included in our stay so we decided to pay 40 euros for breakfast on the first morning until we got our bearings. It was o.k but not outstanding! But try and find breakfast anywhere else in Barcelona as they don't seem to do breakfast full stop! So if you can get a deal with breakfast included, take it! At the end of our stay they tried to charge us for water from mini bar, which we did'nt have so promptly removed from our bill! Reception staff that day were moody and ignorant too. It is a no frills hotel but a good place for a base to investigate Barcelona sites.

Reviews.Title: “I hit it right on the nail!”
Reviews.Author: aboonie
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for the price, without knowing anything about it. I was very impressed. The minute the taxi pulled over, the doorman opened the door and greeted me. I explained I had no luggage, since the airline had lost it. He took me to the reception, told the situation to the rest of the staff and they advised me where to go shop for the basics. They recommended places to eat. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are pretty large for European standards and so is the bathroom. Hotel is completely redone in the inside blending the charm of the hotel with modern ammenities. The stairs are absolutely georgeous! Location is fabulous, within walking distance of many attractions. I loved the hotel and was very happy with my choice. Cons: stay away from the restaurant and they charge you for internet, but if you go to the lobby, you can piggy back on an unsecured network available.

Reviews.Title: “Far Better Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: Tomassinverguenza
Reviews.Content: A bargain "Internet" special led us to the Avenida Palace for 3 nights. In every respect, the hotel stay was exemplary, not least the included breakfast buffet, up to the standard of any of several of the supposed "Deluxe' European hotels in which I've stayed in the last 48 years. The location is near perfect for walkers, with fine access to municipal transit and tourist buses. The staff was polite and efficient, with better English than my halting childhood Spanish. Although an "older" hotel, our small suite (Foyer, bath, parlor and BR) was well kept and comfortable. Overall, I would rank our nights there as among the best in my heavily-traveled memory. The special "price', perhaps due to an economy that seems to keep middle class/middle income tourists at home and limit business travel (the chain seems primarily "aimed" at business travelers), made our stay a veritable "bargain at the price".

Reviews.Title: “Compfortable hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Jenny1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, during a business trip. My room was spacious, but quite old. The bathroom was spacious, but not properly cleaned. I believe that there is an urge for an update. Breakfast was very good and the staff friendly, helpful and polite. The underground station is extremely close to the hotel and the area is close to Barcelona’s most interesting attractions. Of course there are better hotels to stay in Barcelona, but this hotel can be a nice choice for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Dated”
Reviews.Author: yotravel
Reviews.Content: First cut impressions are just shy of grand but the reception welcome was cold and not prompt at all. The room is just about comfortable but feels very dated and honestly quite basic. Having booked a junior suite we were happy with the room size but there is no tea/ coffee maker in the room, which is quite a basic for 4 star hotels now. The bathroom is ordinary and water pressure fails to impress. The breakfast is nice as is the location. Do accommodate for the faint train noise, especially at night time. All in all do compare other options before reserving a room here. Barcelona is full of hotels in this price range and they look and feel better for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with great personnel”
Reviews.Author: Sunni30
Reviews.Content: Arrived early to "drop bags" because ship docked at 6AM. Room was available so they let us check in! Front desk was extremely helpful with how to tour Barcelona. Room was very large and comfortable. Overall hotel was much nicer looking in person! Perfect location! Great unexpected value!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: fhughes47
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff was attentive, polite, but a bit formal. Not what you'd call folksy, but they did their jobs effectively. The location was excellent, near the Passaig de Gracia if you want classy stores, and near the Ramblas if you're looking for fun. The hotel is one block from the Placa de Catalaunya, and there are nice restaurants and tapa bars all around. Here's a tip: You can save money by taking the comfortable and efficient airport bus. It picks you up and lets you off at the Placa de Catalunya and it costs 5 euro per person, as opposed to the 25-30 euro for a taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “we were robbed”
Reviews.Author: Canadian1667
Reviews.Content: the hotel was fine...but just before we were to leave for our cruise ship, we were robbed in the elegant dining room...the staff could NOT have been more apathetic then they were.....the table we were at does not get seen by the 2 video cameras in the dining room..nice coincidence?? The police were not called..we had to do everything ourselves.....the staff suggested the thief must have come in from outside!!!! MY opinion is that it was the restaurant staff and we were setup very nicely...When one of the waiters poured me coffee I thought it was odd he would leans so far in front of me for so long as he poured...I believe he was blocking my view so I would not see someone else taking my wifes purse that was strapped over her chair..unfortunately, it did not dawn on me at the time what was happening....passports, cash, camera.watch etc etc gone...the trip became a disaster because of some thieves...at least we learned that the Canadian consulate was extremely helpful....I will never go back to Barcelona. We were on a small private tour with friends celebrating their 30th anniversary...he is in the tourism industry...he has blacklisted this hotel from his recommended places to stay in this city..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: niki1l
Reviews.Content: Only 20 mins by taxi from airport around 35 euros for 4 of us with luggage. Hotel very traditional inside ,which suited us as my partner and i took my parents with us who are in their 60's. Location was good straight across from the hotel led us to Las Ramlas and down to the water side. Out of the hotel left and then left takes you down to Gaudi's House. Good selection at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: akapaf
Reviews.Content: the Avenida Palace is a good hotel with average rates and nice services. the rooms are good (i've seen two of them) with spacious bathrooms. had no problem with outside noise. breakfast is good. WIFI in the rooms is too expensive, but there's free wifi in the lobby. the location is perfect, between the ramblas and placa catalunya, just behind casa battlò. I would recommend it without doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, cannot find fault!”
Reviews.Author: NicolaWWhitleyBay
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay at this hotel. We were on the 5th floor at the front and it was perfect. I honestly cannot find fault, the staff were helpful and friendly, location was great, breakfast was fresh with plenty of choice and the room was immaculate and spacious. PS; All the hype about the 'Quinze Nits' restaurant is true- it is a must if you visit Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “More of a 3 star versus 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: yanksmiffy
Reviews.Content: Good points: it is central to sights in the city and the rooms are clean and spacious. The bed was firm and comfortable. The bed linens were soft and did not irritate your skin. You can not hear any noise from outside in the streets, but...... Bad points: You sure can hear the subway trains passing underneath the hotel during the day and night. It woke us up each morning around 5 am, when the train service resumed. Despite being on the 6th floor, it can not be missed. Television was the only option for room entertainment. We do not watch television, but prefer radio. Radio stations were not offered on the television, nor was there a clock/radio in the room. Most surprising, there was no coffee/tea service (kettle) in our room. We both thought this was standard practice in hotels these days. Surprising, given they tout themselves as a 4-star hotel. Staff friendliness was mixed. Some were extremely friendly and helpful, others were not. The bath towels were thin and rough. The maid was very loud as she raced through her morning chores. Our first morning in the hotel, we were woken first by the subway train beneath us at 5 am, then again by the maid letting doors SLAM behind her time and again starting at 8:20 am. When I booked the room online, a few months ago,I paid full price and requested a queen or double sized bed. When we checked in, we were given 2 twin beds! Thankfully, they switched our room upon request. I checked online a few days before our departure, and found that the hotel rooms were 40 euro/night cheaper, if I booked last minute.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent find in a great location”
Reviews.Author: caz1950
Reviews.Content: We were two couples travelling together and flew into Barcelona out of Australia so were pretty tired on arrival - to find our luggage had gone astray! On arrival at the Avenida Palace, unfortunately rooms weren't ready as it was early morning, however the staff made every effort to have two rooms available as soon as possible. The concierge was most helpful in regard to the lost luggage and stayed in touch with the airline and airport to try to track it. Apparently this is a fairly common occurrence in Barcelona. The location is fantastic - one block to the start of Las Ramblas and easy walking to the historic old quarter, and down to the waterfront. When our rooms were ready we were delighted to find we had been allocated small suites. These were very comfortable, quite spacious and with good bathrooms - so important. Breakfast, which was included in the tariff, was very good and served in a quite beautifulroom. The hotel is obviously very old and has quite beautiful furnishings, stairs etc, but the important things have been updated. We stayed three nights at this hotel and were sad to leave it to go to another hotel in the business section to join up with a tour. This too was a good hotel - very modern, but the Avenida Palace is the one that stays in our hearts. We would most certainly stay at the Avenida Palace again if returning to beautiful Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “JUST BOOK!”
Reviews.Author: danielmarks
Reviews.Content: We had wanted a different hotel and were a little worried after some reviews complained about unfriendly service etc. However, we had a wonderful stay in Barcelona and it would recommend the hotel to anyone. It was very elegant and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were extremely helpful with every inquiry that we had. My only gripe is that the internet was free but only in the lobby and only if you have your own lap top. Furthermore, you're given pieces of paper which grant you 30 minutes a time so you have to return every half hour to ask for another one. This was our singular complaint everything else was really first class. Just book, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: BullsfanBradford
Reviews.Content: We were a bit dubious about this hotel after reading some of the reviews but it was in the right location & we got a good deal through Travelzoo so decided to hope for the best. What a surprise! Staff were pleasant, helpful & efficient, the room was spotless & very comfortable and the breakfast was good and plentiful (although we wouldn't have paid 20e if it hadn't been included in our rate). The hotel is beautifully restored & centrally located. We had a junior suite at the rear so no noise from traffic but the heating/air con was a little noisy. We were on the 6th floor so the metro running underneath was a very, very faint rumble, it took a whole day to work out what the sound was! We bought a 2 day pass for the bus touristic from reception which saved us 2e each & travelled all over the city using this, the bus stopped just 2 minutes walk away from the hotel. Plenty of restaurants within a 2 minute walk & the hotel is on the Barcelona Shopping Line with the department store El Corte Ingles situated only a block away. The Rambla is only 5 minutes away as is Gaudi's beautiful Casa Batllo. We can't wait to go back & will certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful & Rude Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clr_lou
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona on a business trip and stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. I arrived quite late in the evening after a long day at an exhibition. There were 3 people on the reception desk all of which ignored me for at least 5 minutes while they finished their conversation. A Spanish man came in shortly afterwards and the lady behind reception checked him in before me. I was extremely tired and didn't want to make a fuss so I waited until she was free. She was very rude and abrupt and didn't smile once!! The two men behind reception carried on chatting away to each other and didn't even offer to take my bags to the room. My room was on the top floor and had a view out to the back which was basicaly a car park and office blocks. The room was very dark and depressing and had an interconnecting door to the next bedroom. As a lone female traveller I was not at all happy about having a door between me and the very load man in the next room. I spoke to the rude lady on reception, she said that she could not move me to another room as they were full and she suggested that if I am not happy about the interconnecting door then I should put a chair next to it to make me feel safer!!! The walls are paper thin and you can hear people talking and watching TV in the next room. No drink making facilities and the mini bar was very expensive 3.60 € for a small bottle of diet coke. The only good thing about this hotel is it's location. It is in a beautiful part of the city and is within walking distance of La Rambla. I would not recommend this hotel and I certainly will not be going back!!! The NH Calderon around the corner is a much nicer hotel and I shall be booking in there next time.

Reviews.Title: “The railroad runs through the middle of the house!”
Reviews.Author: protonmeter
Reviews.Content: Ornate hotel built in the 1930's and hasn't changed a bit! A must for train geeks and insomniacs who can time the wonderful Metro service throughout the night - every five minutes! No en suite hot drink facilities. Cold breakfast buffet good but barely cooked mini chipolatas, bacon and some sort of scrambled stuff resembling egg only lukewarm, entirely in keeping with the staff. A great central location but that's it I'm afraid. A waste of great potential, could be a real winner with enterprising ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: montuiiri
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona with my girlfriend where I proposed to her at the Montjuiic fountain. Barcelona is amazing. The hotel lived up to expectations as I wanted the wow factor for my girlfriend as it was also close to her 21st birthday. We stayed 2 nights in a standard and 2 nights in a suite so we got the best of both worlds. Both were of excellent standard. The breakfast was brilliant with lots of choice from cereal, toast, cooked, cakes, cheese and hams, fruits and juices plus much more. It was a great start to the day especially when you walk out of the hotel and be within a short walk of the main area and La Rambla in Barcelona. Would deffinately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very well placed but eat out with the locals.”
Reviews.Author: Jannerbloke
Reviews.Content: We came overnight from Paris on an excellent trenhotel and just needed beds and bathrooms for a week in barcelona. This did that very well. the public rooms and restaurant in the hotel were a bit grand and not well serviced but we didn't need them. This hotel is Ok but there are dozens of others. Just look for the one with the best deal available when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: pearso
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and the resturant staff are lovely and the door man is so helpful but the Reception Staff - what a pack of horrible snobby people, I stood at the reception desk and they completely ignored me and when they did respond you would think that you were asking them to cut their hand off!!!!! The location of the hotel was lovely and the food was lovely, we really enjoyed our stay but I must advise that if you are staying here dont expect good manners from the reception staff. We paid for our breakfast in the deal and the breakfast was lovely. Remember that most of the shops close on a Sunday but alot of resturants are open.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in anywhere in Europe.”
Reviews.Author: afcajun
Reviews.Content: Rudest hotel employees I've ever encountered! We were put in the smallest corner room in the hotel, right next to the maid's laundary shoot and break area...Constant noise. The room did not have an alarm clock, fan, iron or coffee maker. Internet cost 5 Euro/15 min. The breakfast cost 20 Euro and if you wanted coffee, you had to pay 3 euro per person. The only postitive thing about this hotel was the location, but there are great hotels al in the same vicinity. Don't let the pictures from the website decieve you. The foyer and entrance to the hotel is nice, but you will be more than disappointed if you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Irene_Greece
Reviews.Content: Outside the hotel there is a metro station. The hotel is next to Catalunya place and many attractions, museums, bars, restaurants are in a walking distance. Great choice for staying, trust me. It is old building, though renovated.

Reviews.Title: “I'd recomend to a friend!”
Reviews.Author: nekcno
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, always gave us information w/ cordiality. Big room (a bit dark, but ok), bed and bathroom although the bathtub wasn't clean enough to be used (as a tub). Great location in the heart of the city. The breakfast is very nice, w/ good quality of food. They charge 22 euros for an internet access in the room, and the free access on the lobby expires in 30 min... so each 30 min you must ask for another password, quite boring but works.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very well located hotel with good rooms & service.”
Reviews.Author: pebbles033
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a group of eight at the end of a European vacation/cruise. The position is great with proximity to Las Ramblas & Metro/bus stops. The showers in two of our rooms leaked quite badly to the point that housekeeping provided extra towels to soak up the water. Apart from that, the rooms were a good size. We did not have the experience of some other reviewers in not having light etc. We did feel that the hotel was a little over-priced considering that breakfast was not included & would have been 15 or 20 euros extra if we had chosen to have it. Staff were courteous & gave help whenever we requested.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but very small room”
Reviews.Author: SMSLMS
Reviews.Content: \The hotel is well located, close to Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas, but not so close that you hear all the noise. Didn't have a lot of interaction with the staff but overall found them helpful and pleasant. Their English is a lot better than my Spanish. Had wine and tapas in the bar one night and found the service and food to be good. Biggest complaint was size of the room and lack of any kind of view. For the price we would have expected more. We would not stay there long term but for a couple of nights before boarding a ship it was ok

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LAINEYMAY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and its a lovely hotel. Its just a 5 minute walk from Las Ramblas so an ideal location. Its easy to get to from the airport as the train takes you direct to Passeig de Gracia and its about a 5 minute walk from there. The room was a good size with plenty of drawer and wardrobe space and a good sized bathroom Staff all very friendly. We did not eat in the hotel as there are plenty of restaurants all around there.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel but downfalls”
Reviews.Author: amberfletch
Reviews.Content: The room was really clean but was a back room with no natural light and every metro train that went under was felt and heard. It was also quite small and you could not tell what the weather was like until you left the building! The reception staff were not overly friendly, just the lady on the last day, no one asked us how we were or if everything was ok. We did not use the breakfast facilities as it was 20.00 euros for a continental breakfast which is way overpriced, but then all of Barcelona was! There was never anyone in the bar, the hotel lacked any atmosphere really, shame. It just seemed a bit old and stuffy. The location was excellent tho, 2 minutes from Placa Catalunya!

Reviews.Title: “Avenida.....not a Palace”
Reviews.Author: njhoney
Reviews.Content: Hotel located right outside the Ramblas district. I thought it way too expensive for what it offers. Room was small, dark and very dimly lit. Bathroom is tiny and cramped. Toiletries for two days consisted of one tiny thin soap square, tiny generic shampoo, toilet paper but no tissues. Even a short-legged adult has to sit sideways on the toilet or will bump their knees against the sink vanity while the obviously rarely used bidet sits central and unencumbered in the bathroom. Go figure! This non-smoking room really isn't. Nicotine pall still quite evident. Be sure to wear your slippers! Going barefoot on this bedroom carpet will give you dirty, sooty feet! The bottom bedsheet was obviously used - found soot soil and short dark curly hairs. Ugh!The "extra" pillow in closet also was obviously soiled and used. Bed linens however were completely changed on second day. Air conditioner barely blew any air during the day but definitely shut off completely during the night providing no air flow or exchange within room. No view from our room except to see the air handlers and electric boxes of adjoining building. Window opening not recommended due to city sewage odor. The unimpressive, boring buffet breakfast which was not included was ridiculously expensive. The breakfast matron at the door of breakfast room was surly. Filled coffee urns were guardedly kept behind her on a table doled out only in between her assigning guests to tables after she officiously checked to make sure they were indeed hotel guests. Do be careful on the Ramblas day or night. We almost got pick-pocketed by three women during the early afternoon. Good thing we maintained high alert. Night time on the Ramblas is rather seedy: hookers, intense sewage odor, dirty streeets and sidewalks. The Barcelona open double decker tourist bus is a great way to view the city, its architecture and monuments.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, friendly staff, good value!!!”
Reviews.Author: errolh
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Barcelona and staying at the Avenida Place with it's location and helpful staff, especially Elisenda made our first impression of the city one we will never forget. Thank you Ellie!!! E & R from U.S.A......

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: nili_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on march 21th untill march 23th with my husband and teenage son. the location is great,the size of the room was good ,but our room was so dark and has no view.we reserved a triple room,and arrived hotel at 10 am but we wait untill 2:30 pm. their check in time is at 4 pm ,which is not good.in overall we just like the location .

Reviews.Title: “Great room, friendly staff, fab breakfast, shame about the air-con”
Reviews.Author: KingfisherBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Booked B+B for 5 nights using 4 for 3 offer and discount on 5th. (available for Sunday arrival) Spacious, very comfortable room; great en-suite. Specified 'high floor, quiet room' and took 8th. floor room at front. Great views over city with distant sea view BUT lack of air-con - even in February - meant open balcony doors for fresh air and so really bad traffic noise. Very good position for access to Metro and Las Ramblas, also plenty of smaller, cheaper eating places nearby. Would consider again if air con available - 'it's an old hotel' is not a good enough reason for not having this. We loved Barcelona and would return but would probably look for similar hotel in quieter area offering as good a discount and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,spacious, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: ladeela
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i stayed here 3 nights in december on a vacation. the location is perfect if you want to be within a two minute walk to the placa catalunya (one block away) and las ramblas without the noise and congestion! i am so happy that we didn't stay on las ramblas! the metro is in front of the hotel and the passeig de gracia train station to get to figueres (location of the dali musuem for an easy day trip) is just 3 blocks away. there is major shopping, from the huge department store "el corte ingles" (where you can get anything you need including a supermarket) and top end boutiques to chain stores all within a few blocks. the hotel is within walking distance to gaudi's casa mila (5 or 6 blocks) and casa batllo (2 blocks) as well as the old city, so not much of a need to take public transport. there are lots of nice restaurants around and a dunkin donuts a block away and a starbucks 2 blocks or so. a very safe and convenient area! if you want to take the airport bus it is a block away on the placa catalunya, but we didn't feel like dragging our bags and standing in line (although it moved quickly) so we just used a taxi and there was no traffic and the rate was reasonable. the hotel is old fashioned but has a beautiful large lobby. we got a great deal (110 euros/night including tax) on the hotel's website for an upgrade to a suite with a separate living room (own tv) that could be closed off from the bedroom (also with a tv). it had an entry hall with a huge bathroom off of it, so we had lots of space. our room overlooking the main street "gran via corts catalanes" was quiet , clean, and the heat worked well (we could adjust it to what we wanted) and the twin beds were comfy, although seemed a little on the small side (seemed typical in spain). the shower door was what we found all through spain, doesn't go all the way across, instead only 1/2 the length of the tub so can be a little colder than if you had a door to shut all the way and which i never got used to. you leave your key at receptionist when you leave, which was weird but didn't create a problem for us. we didn't eat at the hotel except for some delicious soup that i personally ordered downstairs in the very fancy restaurant and carried back to our room. for some reason they charged me the expensive room service rate instead of the much cheaper rate on the restaurant menu, but i didn't feel like discussing it, so paid it (perhaps the overcharge was just a mistake). i've stayed in 5 star hotels around the world and this hotel was perfect for our vacation needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but no view”
Reviews.Author: bertha007
Reviews.Content: Had a three night break just after Christmas. The room was a fantastic size as was the bathoom. Really clean and well maintained. Only slight drawback was absolutely no view but as it was a short city break it did not really matter. Elegant decor friendly and helpful staff. would definately stay here again. Did not have breakfast in the hotel considered it to be too expensive plenty of eating places nearby. Had an evening meal in the restaurant directly opposite the hotel a bit dearer but worth it.. Close to Las Ramblas and within walking distance of the old port hotel is very well positioned.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced aging hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ccyy4
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline. The hotel made a mistake when they entered their information so we got the rooms for 20% of the usual price. It took some time and a lot of arguing but the hotel did ultimately agree to honor the price, since it was their mistake. Good things first- the location is perfect. It is within walking distance of everything you want to see, of course depending on how much you are willing to walk. It's a block from La Ramblas and really close to the train station. The exterior and the lobby look very pretty and luxurious. The suite was really spacious and there were two flatscreen tvs. There was a separate living room and a hallway leading up to the bedroom/living room/bathroom. On to the bad. The furniture and the decorations looked like they might have been nice once but were now shabby and worn. The rug and bedding were threadbare and could definitely use an upgrade. The worst part for me was that it was dirty. There were hairs in the sink and bathtub from previous occupants and the bathroom floor wasn't clean. My feet were dirty after walking around on the rug barefoot (forgot my slippers). Lastly, the hotel staff is not very friendly and pretty much only answer yes or no if you ask a question. The price for internet service, as mentioned by other reviewers, is outrageous! I have stayed at lower rated hotels that have been a lot nicer (and cleaner). A four star hotel should, at the very least, be clean. Also, I would have traded in the 2 flat screen tvs for newer bedding. Considering the price I paid for this hotel, I feel a little guilty for complaining. If I had paid the list price, I would have been furious! I would not stay at this hotel again, even for the price I paid. On a random note, there was a strike going on outside the hotel while we were there. I don't know Spanish but I am pretty sure it was a workers' union strike. This wasn't until right before we left though, so it wouldn't have affected the hotel service. It made it hard to get in and out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Opulent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meadowsong
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I imagined it to be and more-it has to be seen to be believed!!The location of this breathtakingly beautiful hotel is perfect -close to La Rambla and a short walk to the old harbour 'Port Vell' and the Olympic harbour.Transport from the airport via train is easy and convient and will take you to Passeig de Gracia and from there it is a short walk to the hotel.Within the vacinity of the hotel there are plenty of cafes and restaurants offering good food and outside eateries create a relaxed ambience for dinning.The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating and our room was immaculate(as was the entire hotel)The buffet breakfast was excellent-fresh and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Great location!”
Reviews.Author: pelbro
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a long weekend at the Avenida Palace. This is an old-style, elegant hotel - the antithesis of the lately-popular ultra-modern, minimalist establishments (where we also enjoy staying from time to time). The staff is friendly and multi-lingual. Our room was large with a comfortable king-size bed and two chairs, so that we were both able to sit and watch the flat screen TV. The bathroom was large and supplied with plenty of towels, a good shower and a decent-size soap. We were not bothered by any noise from other rooms nor from outside. Having read reviews from other travelers, we decided to skip the 20 euro per person breakfast buffet and went round the corner to have a continental breakfast for 1/4 the price. Logging on to internet is a bit expensive at 5 euros for 15 min. Other hotels of this category provide internet service for free. We avoided using anything from the mini-bar since the prices are also quite high. The location of the hotel is ideal for seeing the sights and shopping. Bus and metro stops are a few steps away at the corner of Passeig de Gracia. It's an easy walk to Plaza Catalunya and then down the Ramblas and into the Barrio Gotico. Good places to eat near the hotel are Txapela, just up the Passeig de Gracia, for tapas, and La Tramoia, for tapas or a full meal, very near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good loaction but not so good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flitter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights late November 08. Although a good location with easy access to train/underground I would not stay again. The central heating was useless and each day and night the room was far too hot, if you opened the windows you then got the heavy traffic noise and pollution, when reported to staff I was told that there was NO air conditioning. The room safe door was broken and the room was probably the darkest room I have ever stayed in. With plenty of other decent hotels about I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel ..........if they fix the air con !”
Reviews.Author: NB34
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night stay through last minute .com. on a room only basis. Very impressed with the hotel on arrival. Sometimes, photos on a website can be a bit overstating but the Avenida Palace was just like the photos and the lobby / public area is beautiful. The Hotel's location is excellent (no more that 5 minutes liesurely walk to placa Catalunya and las Ramblas) Friendly staff checked us in and took us up to a room on the top floor. (We had requested an upper floor for quietness due to its city centre location.). The room was at the rear of the hotel, was spotless and lovely with a huge bed ,TV and mini bar and a nice large clean bathroom. There was one problem, the Air conditioning didn't work and the room was very stuffy and too hot. (about 30 degrees) I mentioned this to the guy on the desk and he was quite flippant ,saying that "it didnt work in any of the rooms and that we should just open the window". which is what we did and it sorted the problem On the second day, after returning to the hotel shattered from a day walking and seeing the sights, we went to get our key and were told that we would have to change rooms as there was no water on the top floor. we re packed and moved to a larger and nicer room on the 7th floor at the front of the building. This room was just as hot as the other and we opened the window to hear a din of the traffic below . After a sleepless night with the noise from the street we got some earplugs and cured the problem for the next night. As I said before, The Hotel's location is brilliant Just 5 mins walk from the main tourist areas. There are some lovely restaurants nearby which offer better quality and Value for money than those on the Ramblas There is a Metro station right outside the door of the hotel (we didnt notice any rumbling noises from this by the way) Only a very short walk to the placa de Catalunya where you can get the Airport bus (4 euros) or the open top Tourist bus (20 euros) Overall, i would say that this hotel is great but would recommend the following to anyone planning to stay there. 1. Request a room at the rear of the hotel. (no view but quieter) 2. Take earplugs in case you need to have windows open. 3 Breakfast is expensive at 20 euros, but there is a great place called Fargo two minutes around the corner that does a fine selection breakfasts from 2 euros up to 10 euros and has a lovely Spanish atmosphere about it. 4. there is a sweet shop right next door to the hotel where you can buy bottled water for about a euro for a large bottle to save paying the 3 euros for the tiny bottle in the mini bar (you'll need it if they haven't sorted the air con)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Auldayr
Reviews.Content: Ideal for La Rambla and the Barca tourist. Hotel clean, staff friendly and helpful, no coffee facilities in room (disappointing) room small, bed huge. Overall still good value and I would stay there again. Plenty restaurants nearby, buy go off the Ramblas for better value. Can recommend Los Caracoles off behind the white statute at bottom of Ramblas. Taxis reasonable, 5 Euro from Estacio Del Nord to hotel. Metro great value and simple to use, buy a multi Person multi journey ticket from machine in stations. Big bus great value for money 2 days 26 Euro. Camp Nou a must, even for wives.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good spot”
Reviews.Author: rpmc47
Reviews.Content: Avenida Palace is located at the top of Las Ramblas and on a busy urban street with many shops and restaurants. It's a reasonable walk to many of the Barcelona locations that are high on peoples' touring check lists. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We had a room at the front of the hotel on the sixth floor. I read other reviews that mentioned the rumble of the subway that apparently goes near or under the hotel. We did not have that problem on the 6th floor, but certainly noticed the rumble in the lobby...but didn't seem much worse than your nornal hotel elevator noise. There is an internet cafe with cheap fees within 150 yards. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarneyBanbury
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Avenida Palace. Hotel is in a great location close to main square and restaurants. Had a room at the front of hotel no problem with traffic noise due to excellent double glazed windows. Friendly staff and breakfast good. Would recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the extra charges”
Reviews.Author: casa_tyr
Reviews.Content: We found an excellent price for this hotel on Expedia - a lovely weekend to celebrate my daughter's 30th birthday. The hotel was fine - nice location, very convenient. Well maintained. The staff were ok - a bit prefunctory, but probably par for a business hotel. My main complaint were the internet charges. The website touts wifi in every room, plus a business centre. The charges for use, however, are outrageous - 10 euros for half an hour! I'm in the IT business myself, and I know just how cheap wifi is, so I really resent overpricing like this. There is no need for it anymore, and it makes the hotel uncompetitive, in my opinion. Oh, and a small bottle of water in the room costs 3.50 euros. The tap water is horrendous, so you have to pay it unless you remember to shop ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, loved it”
Reviews.Author: Dolly68
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days in Barcelona - fabulous trip. The Avenida Place was top notch - our room was a good size, well furnished and best of all had a small balcony with floor to ceiling doors. We were on the first floor at the front of the hotel, and the noise was not a problem at all (and we slept with the doors open). The hotel lobby is very ornate and good for picture opportunities. Best of all the staff were so helpful and friendly - they booked dinner and entertainment for us, offered advice on places to visit and when we left every morning made sure we knew how we were getting to them. I'm planning another trip to Barcelona and will definitely stay at the Avenida again - I cannot think of one thing to criticise. Mx

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Shajan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located in Barcelona, away from the noise and bustle of the Ramblas but close enough to be able to walk to the central square from where you can organise your tour of Barcelona. The rooms were clean and well maintained and the staff were helpful and friendly, they all spoke very good English too. The rooms had air conditioning which was very much appreciated as it was 30 degrees in August only going down to 26 degrees in the nightime. We stayed with children and were given an interconnecting rooms which allowed us to keep an eye on them. I would definitely stay there again. We booked room only to experience the local cafes etc. for food and we were not disappointed. Places I would recommend are : Udon - a noodle bar in the Gothic Quarter, Ginos - a very good italian restaurant in the Placa Catalunya. For fast food -Pans and Sandwich & Friends were great places for sandwiches, fries etc. Barcelona is not the best place for vegetarians but if you go to the La Boqueria market, it sells fresh fruit and fresh bread which is a real treat for all the senses. It opens really early as all the locals shop there but remember it is closed on Sundays. Do not miss the bus tour conducted by Bus Touristic - excellent way to see the city, hop on & off as you please, but arrive early to make sure you get onto the top deck for a good view. Buses are every 10 minutes and visit all the main sites. If you are not a fussy traveller or are travelling on a budget use the RENFE trains to travel from the airport to the hotel, it is only 2 blocks away and cost the 4 of us 10 euros in total - cheaper than a taxi and quicker than the airport bus.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of Everything”
Reviews.Author: TripAhoy08
Reviews.Content: Was recommended Avenida Palace by a travel agent in Waterford and they couldn'tve picked a better hotel for our four night stay in Barcelona. Perfectly located by Passeig de Gracia train station ( 20mins direct from Barcelona Airport) we were warmly greeted by the front office staff especially Mar and Fernando. We were very happy with our room which over looked the street front. Whilst we didn't dine in the hotel, they happily helped us reserve a table at Shunka . Great location near shops and restaurants, would definately recommend Avenida for a weekend for weeks stay

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a convenience location”
Reviews.Author: testla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Avenida Palace in Barcelona for three days in December last year as a short break to celebrate a birthday. The hotel is in an ideal spot just north of Placa de Catalunya through which you need to cross to reach La Rambla and the waterfront. We arrived in Barcelona mid-evening following a Ryanair flight from Bournemouth to Genoa and caught the Barcelona bus directly to the city. The bus station in Barcelona at which this particular bus terminates is a good 20 minutes walk from the hotel and we were lucky we only had small bags and a good map as we didn’t want to take a taxi. The hotel lobby is ornate with a central large wrought iron staircase and balustrade beyond which is a very small bar leading into the restaurant. The Xmas tree was beautiful and the decorations very discreet. Our room was large and looked over a car park towards the back of the hotel – not particularly pretty but certainly nothing to complain about. We were fortunately on the fourth floor, too high to be disturbed by the rumble of the metro as mentioned by previous reviewers, but we could hear it during breakfast. Breakfast was included in the room rate and as the hotel was not particularly busy during our stay two weeks before Xmas there were only ever half a dozen other tables occupied at breakfast. The buffet was very impressive, the eggs and other cooked dishes piping hot, with a large selection of cereals, pastries, cold meats etc. There is so much to see in Barcelona that three days is barely enough time to take in all the sights. We bought a ticket for the hop-on-hop-off bus that was valid for two days. Although it was quite expensive, it was essential if you wanted to see all the sights as Barcelona is quite a sprawling city. The bus takes two separate routes (northerly and southerly) and we took one on each day. The northerly route takes you through the Passeig de Gracia, where we took photos of stunning Gaudi buildings and then up to Parc Guell which was well worth the stop for a couple of hours with its stunning views over the city. The southern route travels out to Montjuic and the Olympic Stadium and then along to the waterside. Our favourite areas of the city were Barcelonetta and El Born (La Ribera) full of narrow alleys and local restaurants. La Rambla was fine for an evening stroll but the southern end towards the water became a little tatty with a few strip joints and prostitutes. A great city and a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: CARRA23J
Reviews.Content: The main benefit of this hotel is the locationclose to the upper end of La Rambla and just by the Passeig de Gracia tube station and round the corner from the Gaudi House (very impressive by the way). We were however disappointed with the hotel. We found the staff on reception rather abrupt and unhelpful. The room was dark and the view from the window straight into an office is a building less than a few meters away. There was no bar to speak of in the hotel, and although there was a very limited bar menu scattered around the tables in the foyer area but there was never any sign of anyone serving drinks. There was a guy playing the piano in the reception area that made for a nice area but there was never anyone around to hear it as there was no bar. Overall its not a terrible hotel but overpriced in my opinion and while we loved barcelona i think we'd choose another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBW614
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent three nights at the Avenida Palace. I can't imagine a better place to stay in Barcelona. The location is terrific -- close to the upper end of La Rambla and just off the Passeig de Gracia -- within easy walking distance of the lovely buildings in the Manzana de la Discordia as well as bustling Placa Catalunya. The friendly and extremely helpful staff truly make Avenida Palace a treat for travelers. The front desk staff are always very pleasant and make guests feel welcome in any language. The breakfast buffet is extensive and a wonderful way to get ready for a full day of sightseeing (if you are traveling with children, be sure to ask for a pot of chocolate at breakfast -- my son loved it). The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. We will definitely choose the Avenida Palace the next time we are in lovely, lovely Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, except for the metro noise”
Reviews.Author: Gweek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter bank holiday weekend in March and it suited us really well. The location is ideal. Only a few steps away is a metro station, which is both a positive and a negative. It's great because you can quickly get around the city and further afield, but our room did shake every time a train went through the metro station. It didn't bother us too much, as we didn't spend that much time in the hotel anyway. The hotel itself is fine. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. If you make the effort to speak a few works of Spanish, then this is really appreciated. They booked a table for us at a restaurant we had been recommended to visit by someone who used to live there - L'Olive and it was amazing. The restaurant is only 5 mins' walk from the hotel and worth every penny, but you will need to book. Our room was large with high ceilings and a separate hallway entrance area that also led to the bathroom. The breakfast room was a bit small for the number of guests and it could be a bit of a rugby scrum, but the food was replenished quite quickly. Our weekend stay was very expensive, but we think this was because Easter weekend and we booked quite late. In summary, the hotel is in an excellent location and we enjoyed our stay. Just a shame about the shaking room each time a train went through the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Good service”
Reviews.Author: cat65London
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two children to Barcelona for 3 nights. The Avenida Palace was a perfect choice of hotel for us. we had interconnecting rooms. The rooms were clean and spacious and well maintained. Service was good. Staff were helpful and most were friendly. It is in a good location - a short walk to La Rambla. The breakfast buffet was well stocked. A good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Tatty, but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarkBearSF
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel by the Eurostars Cristal Palace, because of construction. Luckily, since location was one of our prime decision points, the Avenida Palace was one block away on the Gran Via de Catalunya. It's a very old-school hotel. Lots of rosewood and plush. Unfortunately, it appears to have seen better days. Things are a bit tatty and worn. Service was wonderful. No compaints. The itnernet connection was a bit problematic. They had an expensive 2-tiered plan. The cheaper one (11 euros/day?) had limited capacity and services. Perhaps I'm spoiled by my experience in the states, where it is often free -- but in this case, I paid more for less.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Avenida in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LarryNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenida Palace for one night on April 2, 2008 after arriving from NY. We enjoyed our stay, and found the accomodations (a double room) very comfortable, and the staff very helpful. The location was very convenient to public transportation, and a very short walk to La Rambla. It was also just a few doors away from a very good Tapas restaurant. The hotel staff provided us with very good information about touring the city during our brief stay. The breakfast was good, and we found the rate to be reasonable. We would highly recommend this hotel without any concerns about you enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on our Spain Trip”
Reviews.Author: Europetravels
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a wonderful 4 nights at the hotel. It was our last hotel on our 2 week trip and our favorite! The hotel is beautiful, staff great and all of them spoke perfect english. The breakfast buffet was nice, but if we didn't have it included in our price, I wouldn't have paid for it. Hotel is in a great location, very nice neighborhood with metro right across the street, but walking distance to most sights. Would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Overvalued, rude staff, crummy rooms”
Reviews.Author: katymill
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in the Avenida Palace. While the location is great, (the hotel is centrally located, within walking distance of many attractions), the room quality, food, and service were inferior, especially for the top dollar room rates. The hotel messed up our reservation, telling us on arrival that we had reserved a single not a double room. After contacting our travel agent they gave us a double room. The desk clerk was rude and unhelpful about it. The room was like a 1950s Holiday Inn. Dark mediocre furniture, thin red carpets and thin, old red bedspreads. The beds were as hard as plywood. The bathroom was dated, though clean. Our double on the 7th floor overlooked an airshaft and was completely dark at all hours. For nearly $500 a night, I would expect an updated room. When we complained about the room, we were not relocated but were given free breakfast, which ordinarily would have cost 30 euros a head. Breakfast was awful and I was very grateful not to be paying for it. Stale bread, incredible in a European city, canned fruit. One morning I asked for fresh fruit, which had appeared earlier, and was told there was no more. In fairness to the hotel, one of the desk clerks was very helpful with dinner reservations. Service seemed to depend on who was on duty. I would never stay here again and would not recommend this hotel to anyone. What a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre experience, but great location”
Reviews.Author: JanJBelgium
Reviews.Content: Old fashioned hotel, outdated and worn out interior. Breakfast average. No free WIFI (17Eur/day!). Location was great however, metro just accross the street, Passeig de Gracia just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: JailbreakJas
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend recently spent 4 nights in the Avenida Palace hotel. It was one of the best holidays we had. The hotel is magnificent. You can not write a review of this hotel without mentioning the staircase. it was so grand. The staff were very friendly and helpful, spoke better english than me! it is in a perfect location, just off of the main street (Las Ramblas) but within easy reach of all the major attractions. Breakfast was varied with lots of choice for everyone. Dinner was limited but as when your in Barcelona you eat out anyway it did not matter. If you are thinking of booking this hotel then do!! it is one of the best and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: sidslow
Reviews.Content: This was a peculiar one, a young single guy staying in Barcelona for the weekend with no hostels or young people's hotels available i opted for this. the price was very reasonable for such an ostentatious hotel, gold leaf and chandaliers at every available opportunity. the location was fantastic, as was the service, and the price, but it just wasnt for me. if you are a middle aged couple, seeking a central location, with good shopping right on your door step, then this catulunian centre piece is for you.... if you are a twenty something bloke with partying on your mind then i'd stay nearer to the olympic quarter

Reviews.Title: “A curate's egg”
Reviews.Author: Tobias-Smollet
Reviews.Content: Splendid situation, impressive foyer, good room. We arrived at about 10.00 pm and they could only give us a cold, hard, boring sandwich for 12.20 euros. A great variety at breakfast but the cooked items were poor. The desk staff said they did not have time to help us set up an internet connection, and they charged 6.60 euros for a KitKat and a tiny bottle of orange juice in the room. Best was the jolly, uniformed flunkey at the door.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Avenida palace”
Reviews.Author: caztrev
Reviews.Content: what a great weekend me and my wife had at Avenida palace, staff very helpful, I dont think we could have found a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “crooks and rude”
Reviews.Author: clarissaY
Reviews.Content: reserved 4 nights with amex for an anniversary. We get there and the room is for 1 person only (an anniversary for one person?) They argue with amex because they want to charge us 3o euros more a night for the extra person. We couldn't leave because it was new years and everything was booked. We paid $2000 dollars for 4 nights ($550 more than what amex quoted us)horrible room, they treated us like unwanted dirt, never gave us but one soap for the first night stay, when we would come in and get the key (you leave it everytime you go out) they never once greeted us nor use proper behaviors..Horrible treatment...

Reviews.Title: “Absolute WORST Hotel Experience Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: hut1020
Reviews.Content: Beware when booking your hotel. We reserved the room through our travel agency and our reservation clearly stated mr and mrs for anniversary and when we arrived the told us the room was for 1 person-and my wife could stay with me for an extra 30 euros (45dollars). They would not budge. Our travel agent even called from the states and they didn't care.Then, we only got the toiletries on the day we arrived-we were there for 4 days. We requested and they never delivered-they were upset with us for arguing the bill. There is no kleenex in the room,take your own, the walls are paper thin-we could hear the couple in the next room. Also, it was warm and since we were on the first floor, we couldnt leave the window open because anyone could enter the room. The so-called concierge/front desk were the most inhospitable people and rude, rude, rude. The breakfast was 20 euros (30dollars) and mediocre at best. We are still arguing the extra 120 euros charged for having the both of us stay there. Also, beware, the taxis donot stop in front of the hotel like other hotels. If you can stay elsewhere, do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: newhorizonsny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Avenida Palace for three nights following a Mediterranean cruise in December 2007. The hotel was very nice, the rooms are spacious with a traditional decor with some updated amenities (flat screen tv). The staff was very friendly, they do have one policy that I found odd - every time you leave the hotel you have to leave your key at the front desk. The best thing about this hotel is its location. The Placa Catalunya is one block away, Las Ramblas is two blocks away and the hotel itself is on the Grand Via at the intersection of the Passeig de Gracia. The metro station stop for the Passeig de Gracia is directly across the street from the hotel (Barcelona's metro system is very easy to navigate). Barcelona is a beautiful city, US travelers should be aware that their official language is Catalunyan not Spanish. They are fiercely proud of their Catalunyan heritage and it seems that they preferred to be spoken to in english rather than american spanglish. This really wasn't issue as most of the hotel staff spoke English well enough. If you have extra time in Barcelona, I would highly recommend checking out the Zoo. For some reason, L'Aquarium is promoted highly everywhere and the zoo isn't. L'Aquarium is ridiculously over priced and has almost nothing to see while the zoo allows you to get closer to the animals than any zoo I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Avenida Palace”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamSquirrel
Reviews.Content: I had a great couple of days at the Avenida Palace in Barcelona. Great staff, very friendly and good rooms. Excellent for business travellers, large, clean and nicely decorated. Location is around the corner from Plaza Catalunya and across the street is a metro station. There are a lot of restaurants close by and also shops. Good location in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “A Step Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: Tamworthy
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at this Hotel. The Hotel is decorated in the most garish fashion. It is straight out of an 1980s script. Although centrally located it is relatively quiet, unless you mind the constant reminder that you are on top of the underground train system. The staff are generally helpful. The rooms are basic and clean with lots of dark wood. Unfortunately, one could hear the neighbours.....the walls are rather thin! The best thing about this hotel is the location. Most tourist attractions are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Overated.”
Reviews.Author: johanneskraw
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Avenida Palace for four nights. Hotel was pleasant enough, good location, friendly staff etc. Breakfast was ok, lots to choose from, but the cooked food wasnt the most appetizing. Restaurant and bar were very expensive compared to the area. I was also charged 5 euro to use their internet for only 15 mins. Stayed on the first floor, where now and again a quiet bass rumble could be heard throughout day/night (possibly metro or boiler?). This noise became annoying after awhile. Window view of back carpark could of been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: jimmcfalls
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful, wonderful place to stay. Centrally located (at the head of Las Ramblas & Placza Catalunya) an dclose to buses, subways and tours. Smiling staff and English speaking when necessary. Breakfast a great start to the day. Clean, neat, responsive. Jim McFalls.

Reviews.Title: “Big bed, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Dingleford
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Excellent location near Catalunya Square and right by the Passeig de Gracia station so easy access to the airport via metro and train. Well appointed rooms - our double bed was so big I couldn't find my husband! The only gripe was that there weren't tea and coffee facilities in the bedrooms, but complimentary tea/coffee and pastries were put out on floor 9 (and our room happened to be on the 9th floor so we found them) from 7am to 11am and 6pm to 9pm every day. We got a pretty good price on [---]justonehotel.com which included the delicious breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: madge02
Reviews.Content: Could not have wished for better location. The hotel is situated right by Catalonia square and a stone's through away from the Ramblas. Also just across the road from metro station which meant that could pop back to the hotel for mini siesta in the middle of the day and then continue sightseeing without any hassles. Another great thing about the hotel is the room we got - the room was extremely spacious and the bathroom huge!! (two sinks....) and in excellent condition. The lobby is beautiful - lovely classic style... breakfast too was great. The only slightly negative comment would be that the reception weren't exceptionally friendly... but who cares the good points by far outweighs the negative. Would definitely recommend this hotel to EVERYONE!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunkissed_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from fabulous Barcelona where we celebrated our 10th Wedding Anniversary and what a better place to stay than at the Avenida Palace. This hotel is of a very high standard and the room was spotlessly clean, airy , air conditioned ( a must ), good size bed and safety deposit box. The staff where very friendly ,accomodating and helpful. We had not been in our room more than five minutes when we where pleasantly surprised to be given a bottle of bubbly on ice and a box of chocolates as a gift for our Anniversary!! We thought this was a wonderful and thoughtfull gesture by the hotel. When we booked months earlier we did state that the visit to Barcelona was a special occasion and only requested a bright airy room. Obviously the hotel and management surpassed themselves on this one. We only ever paid for the room as we wanted to do our own thing food wise and what a good idea as plenty of good restaurants and bars literally on the doorstep. The hotel is in a fabulous location with only a very short walk from Cataluna Square. We even got the A1 Autobus direct from the airport to the square with only the short walk to the hotel with our suitcases. Overall a fab hotel and have already recommended to family and friends and will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: perthsaint
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location near the Ramblas. Good buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelchatter
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute through their website. Well, we were rewarded for doing so b/c we got a beautiful corner room with a balcony and great views! The hotel was gorgeous and very clean! Old gorgeous, but very clean and romantic! The staff was great, very friendly and helpful! Our room was surpurb, again had this amazing balcony. The bathroom was nice, rennovated w/in the past few years. Granite countertops and very nice porcelin tile. The hotel is regal and has a great staircase down to the ballrooms and meeting rooms. Excellent location near the ramblas. Far from the beach, but a great location to shop, dine and vist the Gaudi attractions. Gacudi's Casa Mia and Casa Batllo is a short walk away. We would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: MassTraveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed three nights with my wife as part of a tour group at this property. Location was good with lots of choices to walk to from the hotel including shopping, restaurants, etc. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only downside was our sleeping room which had an inside view looking at windows from other sleeping rooms. I would consider staying at this hotel again if I was looking for an above average (not exceptional) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: upgalway
Reviews.Content: Lovely old-fashioned hotel with a real sense of grandeur. Think winding staircases, marble floors, subtle wall lighting, draping curtains, carvings, carpets, comfortable sofas and lovely coving.. Foyer was so comfortable we could have sat there all day. Felt right at home. Reception staff not all that friendly but the bar and restaurant staff lovely. Drinks in bar ridiculously priced. Buffet lunch in restaurant was very good, very reasonable and the restaurant itself is fabulous. Rooms smallish but beautifully decorated and so so comfortable that they honestly don't feel small. If you want modern, this hotel isn't for you- there are no key cards, you leave your key at reception when you're going out. But if you want to stay in a proper old hotel with comfort and service, without spending an arm and a leg, this ones for you. Very close to everthing, lots of lovely tapas bars, bistros and restaurants a stones throw away. Oh, and we found driving in barcelona absolute hell. Worse than Paris. Worse than Rome. Worse than Boston. Will get train next time. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “the 2nd of two hotels I stayed while in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Baker-Mayy
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcelona on Business and this was the 2nd hotel I stayed in on the trip. For my purposes, this hotel suited me just fine! I had just finished business and took one extra night in Barcelona so I could see the sights having never been to Spain before. This was a great hotel for tourists, especially Americans.. the rooms were oversized. Just about all of the staff I spoke with were able to communicate in English... although I tried out my Spanish, feeling very foolish. The other reason, it was great for tourists, was the locations... I found it to be in a very good area, close to Las Ramblas and tourist sights. I can't say the staff was overly friendly, but they did check me in at 8:30 in the morning which was so convenient. There was coffee on my floor, near the elevators, in the morning and snacks in the afternoon. The bed was firm, just the way I like it. There was no view... for my room anyway, the window, looked out onto the other three walls of the inside of the hotel... bare walls, but since I was not there to gaze out my window, it was no problem... I really enjoyed Barcelona! Beautiful, public art around every corner. Gaudi's architecture was cool and so unlike other places I've been... right down to the enthusiastic tax driver who had a lot opinions about what to see in his city when I said I only had one afternoon. Her nearly killed us both tryijng to write directions on a map, while driving down some narrow street... When I convince my husband to go back to Barcelona with me for a vacation, and I will convince him... I would stay at Avenida Palace. Possibly, I would ask for a room which overlooks the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: vierannie
Reviews.Content: Two short blocks from city center, this lovely hotel is perfectly located. Large room with double sinks in full bath made for comfort and convenience. Included breakfast buffet was ample and delicious. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just a few lovely days”
Reviews.Author: StelJo
Reviews.Content: Barcelona - a wonderful place. The hotel came up to expectation. Very attractive in every way - particularly the grand entrance to the foyer. What a wonderful winding gold staircase with lovely furniture and paintings. Along with the grand piano being played there every evening it was a sheer delight. From there to the entrance of the retaurant it was really a lovely experience. We must say what a lovely dining room it is. It is quite modern considering the rest of the ground floor but still very attractive. As for the dining room staff they were excellent and very attentive. We found the food to be of a very high standard. During the day they had 2 types of buffet - 13 EUROS and 15 EUROS - fantastic value. We ate a few times there both during the day and the evening. (the only other place we would recommend for a change would be Que Que - a tapas type bar serving main meals as well. There was a bit of a problem when we first arrived at the hotel as the girl on the desk was a bit off hand at first giving us an awful room facing a brick wall. However all was not lost as she gave us a very nice big room and bathroom overlooking the front of the hotel. As for the cleaning staff they too were excellent. Overall a wonderful experience and we would certaining stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: micheleg
Reviews.Content: Great central location. Our room was small but comfortable. the biggest problem was there was no A/C available for march and it was very warm. They were very fast on getting us a fan and had to keep the window open...it faced inside so we didnt have noise...but also no view.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: HellyMbro
Reviews.Content: the position of this hotel is great - near the top of catalunya square so easy access to las ramblas, also at the bottom of passeig de gracia so easy to walk up to casa milia (the curvy gaudi building) and the "street of discord" where there is a huge mix of architecture incl. another famous gaudi building. Near to the tourist hop on hop off bus which takes you to all the other sites. I was worried about petty crime before we went to barcelona but saw no evidence of it myself. all felt pretty safe. The hotel was lovely - the foyer and grand staircase very grand indeed. Breakfast was ok - a good selection of fruits and pastries etc. with a small selection of cooked items. Expensive however at 20E each which we did not realise was not included in our tarrif. The front desk staff were fine - we didnt experience any problems with them at all unlike previous reviewers. In fact they obtained a bus timetable for us and were helpful in answering our questions. Our room was a decent size and clean. however it was very hot and the only window opened onto an internal courtyard. We were on the ground floor of this courtyard so did not feel safe leaving the window open. Also the bathroom smelt a bit sewagey so coldnt leave that door open either. I would probably go back to the avenida palace if i returned to barcelona but would request a room with either air con or with a window i could leave open. overall it was clean and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Avenida Palace”
Reviews.Author: UKExpat1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 4 star and it easily meets that rating. The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms are nicely furnished with good quality fittings throughout including a desk and minibar. They are also quite roomy for a European hotel. The hotel advertises that all rooms have WiFi but not stated is that it is very expensive at $116 per week and not very fast. The buffet breakfast was very good with a nice selection of items. Location was excellent with easy walking to the Metro and two shopping areas. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: la2londonLondon
Reviews.Content: I am very lukewarm about this hotel and our experience there. Barcelona is an amazing, lively, late night city but I'm not sure the Avenida Palace gets my thumbs up. The staff were not friendly and seemed to shine only for tips, the breakfast was so-so and the decor was opulent but not special. If I went back, the Hotel Colon definitely has the best location in terms of "being in the heart of it all" and Casa Camper definitely wins for hip, with a fun, fresh feel. The Avenida Palace seems suited more for large groups of tourists (maybe coach trips) or possibly slower-paced, less lively individuals. It certainly was not a bad hotel but I would not praise it or tell my friends about it. Definitely go to Barcelona, don't worry about the petty theft (seems like a lot of hype) and enjoy all that the city has to offer b/c there is a lot to explore!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: PC6789
Reviews.Content: For our third visit in 10 years to Barcelona we had chosen a hotel which was new to us but after a single night we were so dissatisfied we had to check out and we moved instead to The Avenida Palace where we had stayed on the previous occasions. We stayed in an 'exceutive' room. Large bedroom with adoining sitting room and excellent bathroom facilities. Yes it might cost about a third more than a standard room but well worth it. The hotel may be traditional, even old fashioned, but it offers quailty accommodation. It is situated in the heart of the city and all attractions plus the metro/buses/taxis are in the immediate vicinity (literally within one minute).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: NorthernCAGirl
Reviews.Content: I can only say good things about the hotel, the room, the location, the restaurant, except for its staff. I have never dealt with so many arrogant and uncooperative front desk people in my life. They had the worst attitude and talked to you like you were bothering them. The door men were very hungry for tips and made you aware of it. But if it was not for the people who work there, it's a fabulous hotel, absolutely beautiful inside and out. Unfortunately, you have to check-in and out and if you have the smallest of a problem you will get a very cold reception. I was shaking when I finished dealing with them and was glad to be out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay. Not Great.”
Reviews.Author: welltraveled_27
Reviews.Content: I stayed a total of 4 nights based on the reviews here. I have to say, the praises sung about it were way over the top. What was said about the staff (if you scroll down to read the rest of the reviews) was true. They were really aloof and unhelpful. When I asked what was the best way to go to the airport from the hotel, I was given the standard: "Take a cab." This is not true. If you go to the Plaza Cataluyna (about 2 blocks from the hotel), you can hitch a ride on the aerobus for less than 4 euros, vs. 18-25 euros via cab. But I guess I'm getting off-topic. When I first checked in, I noticed that there was a hair (of a very private nature...) left in the bath tub. My shower head seemed like a" before" candidate for a Lime-away ad. It sprayed every which way, flooding the bathroom. Luckily I was staying by myself, so I could use the extra bath towel to sop up the water. The bed was comfortable, though, and the room a good size. I really can't vouch for the cleanliness of everything, since my first impression (that of the hair), was tainted. The doorman made only cameo appearances. He was only stationed at the door a total of 2 times when I was there. My blow dryer didn't work. I didn't bother to call the front desk, since they did nothing about my showerhead earlier. Overall, I would say that the hotel was a 3, in terms of appearance and comfort. That's if you don't count the staff. The staff included would downgrade the hotel to a 2.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: luvindublin
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience at a disappointing hotel on our first day in Barcelona, we were grateful to be brought to Avenida Palace for a first class, luxurious hotel stay. The hotel is absolutely lovely; 5 star rating definitely! The staff was welcoming and friendly, our room gorgeous, and we could not have been more pleased. The moment you step out of your cab and are greeted by the doorman, you know you are in the lap of luxury. The lobby is breathtaking, and in the evening, full of beautiful music from the pianist. Highly recommended and when we return to Barcelona, this will be our first choice for an accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: w_barb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Avenida Palace early November 2006. First impressions were everything that we expected, impressive lobby and the staff very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were clean and comfortable, very well decorated. Breakfast was excellent, the choice was really good, it made sure we left with full stomachs for a days sightseeing. I have read on previous reviews that the cooked breakfast was to be avoided and would agree with that. I warned my husband but he decided to make his own mind up and regretted it, stick to the cold buffet, plenty of fruit, pastries and cereal to choose from. The location of the hotel is brilliant, close to the Placa de Catalunya and the tour buses and only a 5 - 10 min walk from Las Ramblas. Would definitely recommend this hotel and if we return to Barcelona we would have no hesitiation in booking our accommodation here.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Superb
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights there. Room comfortable and clean but we were woken up at 8.30 each day by someone drilling in the room above. Staff very pleasant but no bar as such and if you want a drink you have to look for a waiter they don't come looking for you. Breakfast excellent. Location very good.
