I think I might have expected more from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Palace an understatement”
Reviews.Author: ChiantiSister
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay in Barcelona. Our party was three females aged between 24 and 50. The hotel is amazing and should be a 5 star not a 4 star!! The hotel rooms and furnishings are so stylish and elegant. The bedrooms are spacious and well organised. The bathrooms are sumptous. Breakfast is really substantial and not your traditional continental cuisine. The staff are warm friendly anmd helpful. The location is brilliant only 100 mteres from the Playa de Catalunya and so central for all the major attractions in the city centre. We were able to leave all our luggage safe in the hotel on our last day which was so convenient for last minute sight seeing. The hotel also arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport. Cannot heap enough praise on the Hotel. Will be booking again for the spring!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Bebby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days starting August 13. The hotel was wonderful inside and in a very good location near Las Ramblas and the tour buses. Although it was on a busy street we did not hear the traffic. We arrived early so the hotel stored our luggage for us. The concierge then took it up to our room. We proceeded to tip the fellow but did not have small bills or enough change. My spouse gave him 3 euros and promised more when he obtained smaller bills. The courcierge left very angrily and swore a blue streak in Spanish all the way to the elevator. He probably thought I didn't know any Spanish, but I do speak a little. My spouse did ask the concierge what amount of money was expected. A little later we gave him the promised remaninder of the tip him. However: this experience was very hurtful and we were uncomfortable in the hotel for our 3 days. The maid service was once a day and our room was not always clean. The vacuuming was not done the whole time and table/nightstands were not always wiped down. The front desk was fine and helpful. The breakfast staff were disinterested. The meal itself was not even adequate. The selection was minimal. The meat tasted terrible and the eggs as well. We lived on fruit and pastry. The staff did not refill your coffee unless you asked them to. We always felt they were rushing us out. You may think we should have complained about these experiences, but I have never found it helps and in fact sometimes makes things worse. As well, whom would I complain to? Overall I would say this hotel has great potential but management obviously puts little value in training, supervising and hiring appropriate staff. A hotel may look beautiful but with such terrible service and staff it will fail. I have made this comment based on hotels we stayed at in the same price range and throughout the Mediterranean. I have never had to write a negative review.

Reviews.Title: “Our fifth stay at The Avenida Palace.”
Reviews.Author: Raphiel
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Avenida Palace before we decided to take our daughter and husband for their tenth wedding anniversary.They loved it! This is a modern hotel with good service pleasant staff comfortable rooms and olde world charm. I don't want to recommend it too highly in case we can't get a room there next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Avenida”
Reviews.Author: Aussiguys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in early June. We had a large room facing the street, double glazing kept the noise to a minimum. An older style Hotel but very clean and well kept. A large bathroom with double vanity sinks, full bath tub and plenty of hot water at good pressure. The hotel is well placed at the top end of La Rambla, with plenty of good eateries in walking distance, also only a short walk to the gothic 'old town' and Cathedral. Pleasant and helpful staff who had good english. The Buffet breakfast was excellent, good coffee, Spanish hams, smoked salmon and delectable pastries, no need for lunch after one of these and plenty of fuel to walk off while viewing this marvellous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: hendrixfans
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from reading reviews on this website. We booked for three nights in October and had large, well furnished clean rooms. My sister and brother-in-law had a good room situated at the front with good views, my husband and I had a larger room on the side with absolutely no view and could not even see what the weather was like that day. However, there was so much to see and do in Barcelona that we spent very little time in the rooms. The breakfasts, the serving staff and barman were all excellent. At breakfast, there was even champagne available next to the chilled juices but, we did not realise until the last morning which was too late. The hot food was not appealing but there was lots of 'continental' type food to choose from. The position of the hotel was very central and a good area to come back to at night. (I would avoid the bottom end of Las Ramblas at night if possible, it was a little seedy even in broad daylight). Our hotel reception staff were arrogant and seemed to delight in keeping us waiting for our keys whenever we returned, we thought it was quite funny in the end. They appeared to be able to do only one thing at a time, very slowly even though they were very well aware of people waiting just to collect their keys. We supposed they had to make their mundane jobs more interesting somehow! Do buy a tourist bus ticket, it is a great system and you can interchange the routes, hopping on and off all over the city. A great way to get around and they are very frequent and lots of fun. There is a guide on board every bus and they all speak English, announcing the stops in plenty of time to decide if you want to get off. Barcelona is a great place and we will go back as there is still so much to see which we did not have time for, although we will probably find a better hotel. Generally we found everyone else we met to be very friendly so we think the rudeness may just be limited to the reception at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service is lacking at the Avenida Palace”
Reviews.Author: Aloharunner
Reviews.Content: We were very, very disappointed with the service at this four-star hotel. While the location was good and the lobby and the rooms were nice to adequate and clean, we were treated very rudely and shabbily. Upon our return the second evening of our stay, the key did not work in our room door. The staff tried to open our door for 30 minutes, then told us we would have to stay in another room for the night without our belongings, as they would not have someone available to open the room until the next morning. We said we had medications that we needed in our luggage and they needed to find someone to open the door that night. After another ten minutes, the door opened by chance. The lock was not fixed and we asked to be moved to another room so we could go out to dinner and lock our room. Now they said there were no rooms available and we would have to stay in that room. But if we left the room for dinner, we would not be able to open the lock and get back in. They said "too bad", you will have to wait until the morning for the locksmith to come and fix the lock. We ended up having one person stay in the room and the other person went out to buy food to eat in the room that night. The man did fix the lock the next morning but we were offered no apology or compensation for the major inconvenience and the loss of one evening in Barcelona. We would definitely not return there and would not recommend this hotel. It was really rude service for a four-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable surroundings in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TripadviserTaunton
Reviews.Content: A good standard 4 star hotel in a central location where an impressive reception and lounge area provides the central focus. The appearance is of a well maintained establishment and rooms are very comfortable and of reasonable size. Whilst, situated as we were on the 8th floor, we found it to be very quiet, I would think that lower down you may be more conscious of traffic noise. Rooms come with a decent size bathroom but it appears a little dated. Breakfast buffet was adequate but with a very limited range of hot offerings. The evening buffet is probably the one to miss as it is not particularly cheap and food was luke warm at best. Much better alternatives outside where the hotel is in close proximity to some good restaurants. Staff were very helpful throughout and overall we regarded ourselves to have been fortunate to have found this good city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: parisqueen04
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this superior deluxe property. Prices can be high but if you are accustom to staying a high end hotels than this is the place for you.The staff can be a bit snooty but I was treated with great respect from the front desk manager. When I go on vacation I don't pay attention to who is rude and who is not, I like to make better use of my time. The food that is served in the restaurant is expensive but not so much on the room service. My accomodations were standard with a small view of the city.The room was very clean as was the large bathroom. The property is located a block away from Paseo de Gracia where you can find high end shops and hop on/hop off tour buses. If you are looking for souveniers you can take a 15 minute walk to the infamous "Las Ramblas".

Reviews.Title: “just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: spainbound
Reviews.Content: just back from a 4 night stay at the avenida, it was just right, very clean, smelled lovely, staff very pleasant, with the exeption of the breakfast crew, perfect position 5 mins walk from the ramblas, and the medieval areas, very near to the gaudi houses and the glam shopping on passaige de gracia.. i did have the forsight to e mail a request for a front facing room, after reading an earlier report, they gave us a junior suite!it wes lovely, as was our stay here..enjoy! i should mention that if you want something going on then you wont find it here, but then youve got barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a conference so the only saving grace was that we didn't have to pay for it ourselves. It was very poor value for the rates it charges. It is obvious that most of the investment at this hotel has been made in the lobby - mostly in marble. However, not much has happened in the rooms. The bathroom was relatively new, and had good water pressure (which we had at all the hotels we stayed at). However, the bedroom area could definitely use some updating. The mattress must have been there since the hotel was built 50 years ago. Both my husband and I accidentally fell off the bed because we sat too close to the edge. The colors are all dreary and rather depressing to be around. Friends staying at the hotel had a number of exciting experiences, ranging from showers that didn't work to a room that smelled REALLY bad. Definitely not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “On balance - good value”
Reviews.Author: RamblingJohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with 2 friends for 3 nights. Both rooms were clean and well-appointed but the view from both rooms was the concrete light well. There were no alternative rooms on offer. The bathrooms were spacious and well-equipped and the minibar offered the usual delights. Throughout our stay there was only one lift working and trips to and from the 8th floor could take a long time. Breakfast was excellent but the staff needed constant prompting to replenish the buffet, particularly with the outstanding scrambled eggs. One hidden asset - we developed the habit of nightcaps on return to the hotel at night. The seemingly high-priced drinks turned out to be a bargain as they were served in enormous tumblers! The waiting staff and concierges were bright and helpful but the reception staff were rather more taciturn although pleasant enough. We paid a reasonalbe rate for the rooms through alpharooms and would rate the hotel good value on that basis. Location is excellent.
